description:
Bernie's is my favorite coffee shop in the city. I love the vibe. Bernie and her staff are wonderful people and they make the best coffee. Highly recommend the honey hazelnut latte or iced Bernie. 

Stroll right by the Starbucks down the street and visit this neighborhood gem. You'll be glad you did. :)
author: Kelly M.

description:
I would be lost without this place. 

Bernie's is the perfect neighborhood coffee place - not just great coffee and great atmosphere, it's about the people who work here and how welcoming they are, and how they get to know you and you get to know them. The whole crew is amazing, led by Bernie who is a delight and can put anyone (even a cranky 2 year old or a shy 5 year old) in a good mood. It makes the neighborhood truly feel like a small town and you can't put a price on that. I love it, my kids love it, the whole family loves it. Thank you Bernie!!
author: Kristy F.

description: I ordered an almond milk latte with a spinach and feta french pastry. It came up to a little less than $10. Service was spectacular! The cashier was super nice and friendly--something you don't always get at sf coffee shops. The latte was good and the pastry was also good. Neither blew me out of the water, but overall, I had a good experience. If you're able to nab a table by the window on a sunny day it is the perfect spot to get some work done!
author: Angelina H.

description: Bernie's is the best coffee on 24th St. and the staff is always friendly and fast.  Bernie is a local girl that is doing right by the neighborhood.
author: Christian A.

description: I love this place, so quaint and peaceful. If you want a perfect mocha and a relaxing atmosphere then go to Bernie's!
author: Tabitha H.

description: Super homey cafe with a wonderfully welcoming staff, and dope soy lattes. As a student, I appreciate the ability to camp out here in a sunny window and study away with some fun music in the background. Definitely one of my new go-tos in the city
author: Michaela N.

description:
Bernies is an adorable and warm coffee shop in the delightful Noe Valley. I got happy vibes just walking in to this cute shop. I decided to order a Bernie's favorite - the honey hazelnut latte - and they were happy to go easy on the syrup for me. 

The latte was smooth and the honey and hazelnut flavors really added a nice touch! There was no bitterness, which leads me to know that Bernie and her staff really know how to make FANTASTIC craft coffee.

Head over to Bernie's for a lovely cup of Joe amidst a welcoming environment!

Edit: I met Bernie today and what an absolute sweetheart she is! My goal is to become a regular so we can get on that coveted first-name basis :p This place is a true neighborhood gem.
author: Sabina S.

description: Great coffee and staff. An actual small business, owned by a San Francisco native and neighborhood local--a rare treasure in this day and age.
author: Luke T.

description:
Yumyum pumpkin spice latte with almond milk! Was surprisingly good... :) will definitely be back.

It's in a great location and has good work space :)
author: Monica J.

description: Love the local vibe!  Fast internet and power outlets!  Coffee and pastries are excellent also.
author: Vein K.

description: Bernie's is the local coffee shop every neighborhood needs or it should be so lucky to have. You witness the love when Bernie is working as she greets and has personal conversation with the regulars and quick to welcome new comers. Having move to SF from Philly it was such a great to find this gem. They can also make a delicious cup of coffee and once they become familiar with your order you don't have to wait.
author: Joan R.

description: Good coffee, not the greatest, but good.  interesting pastry nice people working there room to sit down
author: Ramin A.

description:
Very cute and cozy coffee shop in Neo valley. They have a pretty standard drink selection, and immediately after I ordered they engaged in conversation with me speaking to the neighborhood feel of the café. Even as I sat and did work, I watched the barista's engage with other customers which really showed their customer service levels.

Although my latte could have been a bit hotter, the taste was great as was the banana bread that I tried on the way out. Will hopefully be back!
author: Kyle S.

description: Bernie's could have the best coffee in San Francisco.  Definitely the best in Noe valley.  The inside is very cozy on a cool day, but sitting outside people and dog watching cannot be beat.  They are always fun and friendly.
author: Diane V.

description: Cool coffee shop in Noe Valley. My coffee was delicious and the service fast and friendly. Love the local San Francisco coffee shop feel! I used to live in SF and it is places like this (local, friendly, delicious) that make me miss the city so much!
author: Dana G.

description: Extremely clean and reasonable prices. Great staff! Can't believe I didn't come here sooner. Definitely recommend this place for a quick breakfast or if you have some quick work to do. Great Ambiance and vibe. Breakfast is delicious and fresh. Love that we can have our drinks in a mug and save that paper.
author: Ayan And Alice A.

description: Bernie's is the cutest little coffee shop in Noe Valley. An iced Bernie with almond milk is a must have for me and my friends. The macaroons (and other pastries) are delish! To top it off, the owner is the kindest person you'll meet. Bernie goes above and beyond and makes the shop feel so warm, inviting, and a personalized experience.
author: Madison S.

description: Smaller coffee spot with only a few tables, but I've found a seat everytime. Right next to Whole Foods so perfect for those days where you need to do a little grocery shopping right after. Staff is nice, and they have some small bites to eat as well and I've tried the burrito but it's meh.
author: Avani G.

description:
Delicious coffee shop, and run by an amazing woman, Bernie. No one in the city is as passionate about the craft of coffee, as this woman. She trains a professional staff, and keeps fresh, local foods and treats in the assortment. 

I highly recommend stopping thru, for fine craft coffee.
author: Diosa L.

description: Nice little local coffee shop. Coffee nice and strong, and carrot zucchini bread is awesome! Friendly and dynamic staff. Nice spot to relax or do mobile work.
author: Desiree R.

description:
I usually come to Bernie's a few times a week to study/work.

Pros:
-Cute neighborhood spot
-Lots of tables to get work done
-Overall chill vibe
-Staff are always super nice, as is Bernie herself!

Cons:
-Coffee is ok. I'm not a coffee snob by any means, I don't care for the latest and greatest french press or cold brew coffee, but the coffee is average.  I usually stick with the regular latte and found that to be pretty good!
-This place is always cold.  They leave the door open at all times, even at night, in January and it's freezing in here.
-My biggest issue with this place is the bathroom.  It always smells like a urinal and just never feels really clean to me.

I'll continue to come here since there are tables usually available and spots to work are sparse in Noe, but Bernie please fix the bathroom smell. :(
author: Ayesha M.

description: Bernie's is hands down the best. We go through a pound every week or two and really enjoy going to pick up our next bag.  I've become spoiled and just don't like cheap coffee now! The employees are sweet, and the location is so easy.  We love this little coffee shop!
author: Tiffani C.

description: Great people serving and quite a local community sitting and walking around. Seating area outside also. Go Bernie's
author: Peyton G.

description: If you knew me, you'd know that I am here *literally* every day. On a part of the 24th St. strip that's surrounded by cafes, there is a reason why I keep coming back: It's love in a cup. Bernie's isn't just about the (delicious) coffee. If you rarely come here, you may not notice it. But spend any amount of time here, it becomes clear that Bernie's is the only cafe in the area that truly fosters community.
author: George L.

description:
A large soy cappuccino and a morning bun will run you $7.25 at Bernie's so it's on the spendy side for a coffee and a pastry. I'm not sure where they get their pastries but I don't think they're the draw - I think the delicious coffee, friendly service and seating are the draws here. 

While the seating is relatively limited (5-6 tables inside and one park bench out front), it's a decent amount of seating for this neighborhood.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Went in this morning and ordered an XL mocha. The cashier told the barista my order and after I paid I went over to wait. She was engaged in conversation by some talkative customer whom she appeared to know well. She finishes up what she was making then turns to me and asks what I ordered. Which the cashier had just told her. OK.

She put far too much water in the mocha - I saw her pour it in and was shocked; I should have said something. The result was a weak and unsatisfying drink.

While I am not a big coffee aficionado, I've been here before several times over the years and have always been relatively satisfied. This time not so much. Given this experience I'll continue to go to Martha's.
author: Mike K.

description: I give it 4 stars instead of 3 because the service was really nice. However, the breve latte I ordered was pretty awful compared to what Im used to. Even though the flavor was ok the foam was not creamy but airy. I guess i'll give them another chance
author: Sara V.

description: Wonderful staff. Very welcoming to out of town-ers. Employees knew nearly everyone who walked in by name. It is impressive and rare now-a-days.
author: James R.

description:
Very awesome service and well-maintained place. 
There cafe latte was delicious and creamy. 
The decor is pretty cool inside as well. You'll find a lot of young people working on their laptops. They have pastries which we didn't try but they looked pretty good! I'd certainly recommend the place for coffee
author: Rachida I.

description: Very cozy, local coffee place surrounded by well known coffee chains.  If you want to step away from the Starbucks, Peets and Philz of the world, this is a very nice option.  Coffee is good and has variety of good selections of pastries.  Quiet, less traffic if you want to host a meeting or just setup station to work.  Mainly locals and casual people come here.
author: Jim K.

description: Great, friendly vibe at this locally-owned coffee shop. Good food options and nice coffee too. Seating area outside also.
author: Yamileth B.

description: Amazing costumer service. Good quality coffee and tea drinks. Highly recommend London fogger. Barista Omar is my favorite, he is so cool I wanna be his best friend.
author: Sharon M.

description:
I met up with a couple friends for a morning coffee at Bernie's during a trip to San Francisco. It was right near where I was staying, and felt very much like a comfortable neighborhood coffee shop, on a cute, walkable street.

The place was pretty quiet at 9:00 on a Sunday morning. It was a nice spot to play catch-up. Service was friendly and there was ample seating. The space was charming, and there were lots of attractive pastries behind glass. I had a lovely cappuccino, lush with milk foam.

I gather Bernie's has free wifi, so between that and the warm atmosphere it's more or less an ideal neighborhood hangout. I'm sure it's well loved by the people of Noe Valley.
author: Steph C.

description: Stopped by on a walk through the neighborhood for a regular latte and a matcha latte. Came out to $9 for our two drinks. The cafe itself is cute with seating and tables for studying or chatting with friends. They have a wide selection of pastries, breakfast burritos and Odwalla juices in addition to the drink menu. Both the the latte and matcha latte were extremely bland and watered down tasting which was disappointing. I did not enjoy my latte. The bathroom was also not clean and had that pungent public urinal smell. Too bad; I wanted to like this place because it looks so cute from the outside when I walk by every weekend. Sadly, I will pass on their coffee drinks.
author: Aleyna S.

description: I had the honey hazelnut latte and it was great: not overwhelmingly sweet and you could taste the hazelnut in its deep flavones. comfortable seats and tables to do work. free wifi. the only complain is the dirty bathroom. Would go back to this place to work and have honey hazelnut latte.
author: Helia S.

description: If you're waiting in the ridiculous line at Griddle Fresh come over here! This is the perfect little local coffee shop and the staff is nice and friendly. The coffee itself was very good. I had an amazing almond milk latte. Would definitely recommend anyone to come here if you happen to be in the area!
author: Carly H.

description:
Incredibly disappointed and underwhelmed. My bestie and I came here and ordered two different lattes, the honey hazelnut and she had the pumpkin. Both were watered down and tasteless. Not to mention that despite we ordered the same size, her cup was noticeably bigger. 

The environment wasn't thriving which may be the reason why the baristas weren't the friendliest of people. 

It has a great exterior though and a nice book selection for kids. 

Pretty sure they had a restroom but didn't stay long enough to use it.
author: Natalie Y.

description:
Been traversing around SF studying in all its wonderful coffee shops and I landed here on a Sunday afternoon after roaming around Noe Valley looking for a quiet place to study. I was pleasantly surprised when walking in to find the place pretty empty and spacious! Their coffee and pastries are delicious, there is plenty of table space and outlets, and wifi was speedy. 

For those that would like to get their productivity on, definitely stop by here! :)
author: Jingxi Z.

description: I just found out Bernies is closing ! I am from SF but live in Portland now ! Every time I come home I visit Bernies and have coffee w my sister in law! So many memories there! Customer service is great , atmosphere is amazing . I'm going to miss this place ! Such sad news !
author: Shelley M.

description:
1st visit: Internet slow, but bearable.
2nd visit: Internet absolutely refused to connect no matter what including restart. 

I won't be back. I rely on internet for working at coffee shops.
author: cc v.

description:
Yumm - love this coffee shop. So glad they instituted even larger cups for my caffeine habits. I really like the morning cake (or is is bread?) and by bf likes the Marble Cake and cookies, pretty much everything there.

One remark is that I cannot tip on my CC and never have cash so feel like these folks are missing a golden opportunity.
author: Megan V.

description:
THIS is a place of love. It's a cafe filled with yummy treats, strong espresso, lots of seats/tables, a few sacred outlets and many extraordinary people. It is run by the owner and overall super hero, Bernie. The 24th St. location is the only one of her 3 self-made locations that I've been to, though I'm dying to check out both the Castro and Downtown locations as well. 

In short, Bernie's is a cafe made for the people, by the people. It is a place to come and study, to catch up on social life needs, to read a book where the sun peeps through in the two comfie front chairs or - if you're lucky enough - to make a few new friends. I'm blessed to call Bernie a friend and the rest of the badass young women who work alongside her too. It isn't a chain, it isn't a snobby Starbucks... Its a yummy cafe built for a neighborhood which encourages kindness, community outreach and authentic self. I am lucky to call Bernies my go-to place!
author: Abigail M.

description: Bernie's definitely seems to be a neighborhood locale. While sitting outside enjoying my coffee and croissant, several patrons walked in an immediately saw someone they knew. It was kind of endearing. I was more of the drop-in neighborhood adventurer, but Bernie's definitely fulfilled my morning coffee and snack needs. My order came in just under $8 and wasn't especially special by any means, but it also wasn't terrible. The chocolate croissant met my expectations and the hazelnut honey latte was also pretty decent. Definitely on the sweet side, but that's to be expected.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I recently relocated to SF, so I'm in the (enviable?) position of needing to discover my new neighborhood haunts.  It looks like Bernie's is my first one!  Stopped in for a decaf iced latte this morning, and while it was particularly delicious, that isn't why I'll be back - at least not entirely.   

While I waited (briefly) for my coffee, no less than seven employees and fellow patrons stopped to make conversation.  They each welcomed me warmly to the neighborhood, hoped I'd be back in so we'd run into each other again, and joked that if I didn't come back I should "at least not go to Starbucks."  This spot has an incredibly warm, neighborhoody vibe that I didn't even know I was looking for.  

On top of that, my coffee was darn good. 

See you tomorrow, new friends!
author: Kali M.

description: Good prices and a pretty good selection. Super nice staff and some really awesome looking pastries. They have plenty of dairy-free options as well.
author: Brian C.

description: Good espresso, good selection of magazines, open late.
author: Alex M.

description:
Bernie's is a nice spot to grab a coffee, tea, to go, or to hang out for a bit.  I found the staff to be fairly friendly and helpful.  It's a cozy place to hang out and it's quite active during the day.  It's a small place, so if you're hoping to grab a seat, be prepared to possibly wait until there's room.

It's conveniently located next to Whole Foods, in case you want to do some shopping before or after your morning mocha.  

The reason I gave this place 4 stars and not 5 stars is that I'd love to see some more tea options (& a different tea bag or steeper.  My tea leaked all over me), some faster wifi (The wifi was a bit slow.  Maybe I caught it on a bad day), and cleaner bathrooms.  

I will certainly visit Bernie's again.  It's a great spot in Noe Valley!
author: Mary L.

description: Great coffee and pastries and cozy little shop on a rainy day!  The barista seemed a little distracted and taciturn but was still helpful!
author: Chelsea D.

description: Grew up in Noe Valley and fell in love with Bernies. It is the perfect neighborhood coffee shop. The drinks are amazing and always recommend the empanadas. I hate to see a location close. Small businesses should always be supported and not brought down. keep the locals local. I highly recommend everyone to go in you'll fall in love with the staff, they make you feel like family and at home.
author: shelby o.

description: The go-to place for amazing friendly service, whether it's first time or you're a regular.  The coffee is the best, bar-none.  Beats Starbucks brown water for sure.  They have a great selection of pastries or quiche and other more hearty choices.  There's no place where you'll feel so welcomed.
author: KEL C.

description: It's a cute neighborhood cafe!! Just loved the ambience and the service. It has good seating and you can spend time working, reading or just relaxing. It also overlooks the street and has cute little shops around. They serve Tully's coffee and also offer a small collection of snacks/quick bites that go well with the coffee!!
author: Puja I.

description:
The owner is always there to greet me whenever I show up, the staff is kind and helpful, and the atmosphere is relaxed, never pushy.
Free wifi! And great lighting so you can work on your laptop - like me - and not feel like you're about to take a nap! As a Noe Valley resident, I'm happy we have this spot, and so close to the J!
Only wish they were open later but...this is Noe Valley afterall!
author: Kristina B.

description:
Small shop in noe valley, but a surprisingly great place to study and get things done.  Sat here for a couple of hours, no looks from the staff (looks like they are used to it), good background music, long tables - college style, and a power strip located towards the back.  

Oh, and the coffee is pretty great too.
author: Patricia K.

description: Great coffee and friendly staff, I hope they have tap water available for customers to help themselves though.
author: Yifan J.

description: I am so happy to have found this little gem of a coffee shop! It is in a prime location and has a very warm and welcoming vibe. I am currently obsessed with their turmeric lattes with almond milk. I am not sure if the turmeric lattes are seasonal, but I do know they have a variety of unique drinks. I definitely recommend checking this coffee shop out!
author: Lauren B.

description:
The peolple are nice and mostly friendly. It is sad that Bernie is hardly around. The employees are often busy with themselves talking amongst each other. So often they forget what I was ordering or didnt make it right or the coffee was luke warm. After a while I had enough of that.
It used to be my favorite place for about two years, but now it is annoying, and I go to Starbuck across the street.
author: Chris A.

description: Such a cute lil cafe! Wandered in here on a random afternoon and it was bustling but still mellow. Lots of place to sit, speedy wifi and really sweet baristas! Love reading here :) I spilled my tea the other day when heading out and they offered me a new tea on the house + end of day they hand out pastries left over from the day!
author: Sharmeen T.

description:
Just visited Bernie's on 18th st!
Drinking a delicious Bernie's iced coffee, made by Bernie herself!  
Delicious
author: James T.

description: This is a long overdue review for one of my favorite places in Noe Valley! I've been working in the neighborhood for over four years and Bernie's has been my go-to from day one. Other than having THE best chai in the neighborhood, Bernie and her staff have always made me feel welcomed and loved and part of the merchant community. I love stopping in for my caffeine and baked goods, but I also love a chance to chat, catch up and soak up some friendly, good vibes. And I've been lucky enough to have some Bernie's staff visit my salon chair and share the local business love. Bernie's is what SF is about, so make them your local favorite this very second!
author: Chris O.

description: I was pleasantly surprised with how good the decaf drip coffee was here, having been a regular at Philz, further up the hill.  They also have delicious biscotti and the frittatas (I had mushroom & spinach) are an excellent food option.  The work tables are comfortable, the internet good, and the bathroom is clean.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Laptop camper here. I've camped at Bernie's a few times. It's a cozy, busy neighborhood spot in a Victorian building. There are pictures of Bernie and her kids on the wall. It feels like you're in Bernie's home. You might have a hard time finding a seat. It's very popular with chatters and campers. 

They have a case of pastries (muffins, croissants, morning buns, cinnamon twists, scones, mini cupcakes), juices, cookies in glass jars, calzones and burritos. 

* Latte ($3.60 for large): served very hot but it's not rich or smooth, it's rather harsh
* Croissant: bland, flabby, soft, didn't seem fresh

There's a kid's corner with a kid's table, books and toys. If you don't have your laptop with you, you can use one of the computers there (for a fee).

You know you love me. X0 X0, laptop camper.
author: Lolia S.

description: Honey hazelnut latte, yum. People are nice and my coffee is good. There's wifi and usually a couple of empty seats. I stop here often right after eating brunch at Griddle Fresh because I like the coffee here much more...
author: Lily C.

description: I decided to check out this coffee shop while I was walking around the Noe Valley area. I'm glad I did because I met Bernie, the shopowner. I got a banana bread and a pumpkin latte. The pumpkin latte was so good, I knew I had to give this place a 5 star rating!
author: Attallah C.

description: This place is a dump!  The last time I went there was a dead baby cockroach in the bottom of my coffee cup and I had drank all the coffee. I really don't know how this place is still in business.  The Baristas if you can even call them that,  are rude and weird, they wear clown looking makeup and it doesn't fit the neighborhood.   I used to work next door and went to Bernie's maybe 20 times total.  I always order that same thing and the SAME girl always took my order.  Each time my beverage was a different price. I always ordered the exact same thing!  This girl tried to be friendly a few times and I told her i was married. Then she started charging me more. I always pay with cash and I get the feeling this girl is just pocketing the money.  Go to Starbucks instead it's right down the street.
author: Justin N.

description: Pretty bitter on the double espresso which makes me sad since they're so close and the place is really cute!
author: Dina F.

description: This is a great local coffee shop! Bernie, the owner, is very friendly and always remembers regulars. It can become quite packed but if you get a spot at the big table you won't be bothered. It's a great place to work and chat. There are always local families sitting on the benches outside.
author: Lydia W.

description:
I really thought this place would be more like a "coffee shop" hole in the wall place instead of a generic looking cafe. 
The ambiance I give a 8 because it was very quiet and laid back but it was too mom and pop shop, I guess a place that locals favor instead of out of towners looking for speciality coffee. The mocha was just okay, and the black iced tea was delicious so I give the drink review a 5 just because it was only meh. A cute place, but not a place I would write home about!! Don't let this dissuade you from coming here though! It just wasn't what I was looking for on my trip to the bay.
author: Erin J.

description:
After waiting 20 minutes for a table (and subsequently being told we had another 45 minutes to go), we ditched the idea of brunch at a restaurant and walked over to Bernie's to eat (read: to keep from passing out).

With no line and barely any wait, we ordered at the counter, and grabbed seats indoors. The honey hazelnut latte is actually pretty good. I didn't note any honey (as I'd requested it "not too sweet"), but the hazelnut was definitely there, and pretty tasty.

Service was fine, the quiche was the best thing there (Italian wedding cookie: meh, peach scone: eh), especially with a hefty squirt of Sriracha, and the prices were fair.
author: Adena B.

description: I am so addicted to the Honey Hazelnut Latte. I tried it cold once and it didn't meet my standard for it. I tend to go for the double shot and I tried a large this time around. It was perfect and the people behind the counter are very nice. It's definitely way better than Starbucks and I prefer to support a local shop than a capitalize business. On my last visit, I tried the mocha latte, it was good but I prefer the honey hazelnut. I would go back for both though but maybe having one at a time than both at a time because it threw my taste buds off a bit.
author: Star S.

description:
Good location and cool space, but if you're looking for good coffee from a place that knows what's up you'll be bummed like I was. We hadn't tried it so we gave it a chance and we won't be back. 

No cold brew (the dude didn't even know what it was). No Chemex. 

Skip.
author: Marcus C.

description: So, this was the WORST cappuccino I've had in the past year. Including airport Starbucks. There was a gallon of meringue on top, it was ludicrous. The espresso was burned turd juice. It was SO bad.
author: gary g.

description:
Cheap and non-pretentious for a coffee shop that offers free wifi! It is more cozy than luxurious but it is your avg mom and pop kind of coffee shop. Ummmm, more like friend and friend coffee shop.
What really adds to the 2 positives I notes above is the location and that right around it are esoteric shops which bring interesting people there.
Sip your coffee as you watch people and their pets walk by or read a book or work on your laptop!
author: Varun T.

description: We used to live in SF and miss all the great #notstarbucks options.   On a recent visit back to the city my mission was to find a cafe for coffee and a scone.   Bernies is the spot!   It was a rainy day so I was hoping to bring my pup in with me.   He had to wait in the car (don't worry,  got coffee to go) but hd was almost as happy with the doggie biscuits as I was with my treats.
author: Diane D.

description:
I've been on the hunt to find a coffee shop in my neighborhood, one that is not Starbucks. I'm glad to announce that I think I found my place. First of all, I love the atmosphere here. There's big tables, outlets and free wifi if you need to get some work done but there's also small tables and outside benches if you want to chill and read a book or meet up with a friend. 

And of course, for the coffee, it's also great. I tried one of their specials, the Honey Hazlenut Latte, and was completely satisfied. They also have a wide variety of drinks, all within reasonable prices. If you're feeling hungry, they have tons of snack choices, including pastries and breakfast burritos, but I'll have to review that upon my next visit. The baristas were very approachable and easy to talk to, which I appreciate. I will definitely be back and I recommend this place to anyone in the area.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Delicious coffee, laid-back ambiance, free wi-fi, mothers breast-feeding babies (which means all types of milk are available)...

The people who work here are lovely, as is the MOST HANDSOME MAN I'VE EVER SEEN studying from a textbook at the table across from me. I'd sit here and drink coffee all day for this view.

Bernie's is apparently a local staple, and they offer a variety of pastries and bagels. Of course, they're nothing like NY bagels, but a noobie can't be choosy. I love the "children's corner," which boasts a variety of books and mini-chairs. Ah yes, stroller valley. Maybe the man with the textbook will make an honest woman out of me :)
author: Ray J.

description: Walking into Bernie's was a really pleasant experience. The staff was very friendly and helped to ensure I got what I wanted. My cappuccino was soooo perfect. The foam was just spot on! I also ordered the spinach and mushroom quiche which was amazing too. After telling the barista that my drink was so enjoyable he really seemed happy. He clearly cares about the product he produces and as a customer I was very appreciative.
author: Spencer K.

description:
Since moving to the East Bay I've discovered just how spoiled I was by this place. The fluffy, moist goodness of the frittatas has yet to be matched, and the sriracha is a perfect accompaniment, especially for the sundried tomato. I paid for a BART+Muni trip across the bay to come back here. It's a great treat to come back to the city for.

I also grabbed a gluten-free alfajore (al-fa-hor-ay), a starchy Argentinian treat that I had started to miss since moving!

And the lattes have only gotten better!
author: Omar Y.

description:
I love going to Bernie's(B1) early in the morning.  I am greeted by my name and a smile.  They even remember what I like.  You cant beat the service.

Jan(Barbara) from 24th St.
author: Jan L.

description:
Super charming cafe in Bernal Heights. Great coffee, very friendly staff, many tables and some outlets. Solid free wifi for you to bust out your macbook air, start typing on it, and hopefully be seen, while you are getting some work done.

Ambience is quiet and very work friendly.
author: Andy J.

description:
Love this place. I would give 5 stars but one of the girls working here was rude and gave horrible service. We also order a breakfast burrito (pre-packaged) which just needed to be heated up. She microwaved it, forgot about it. About 10 minutes later we had to ask about it and then she served it cold. 

In the mornings my girlfriend has gotten burnt coffee which wasn't good. They seem to be best around mid-day. With a little bit of work this place could be 5 stars.
author: Rob L.

description: Normally a little quieter than Philz further up 24th and the Starbucks across the street, this is a friendly cafe with free wifi, nice coffee and a local feel. Definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area and looking to do some work or just chill out for an hour.
author: Dominique G.

description: A cute place to hang. Not overrun. Wish the seats were cushier.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Bernie's cafe  now has  another  location  on 18th Street  !   That's great news, even closer to my house and Dolores Park .The Coffee is still wonderful, the almond milk lattes divine. Bernie is the best, Angel and Miguel welcoming. The new place, the old Phil's, is bright and friendly. I even think that the prices are better than other places, or at least seems so because I am happy   to be there.

gabriella
author: Gabriella S.

description: Espresso shots are always pulled real nicely. I like the vibe here. Not too loud, not too boring. Just a really nice cafe with some nice kids behind the counter.
author: Dee D.

description:
Would make the journey from Union City, over and over again!!! Got a Bernie's favorite (like always) of the Honey Hazelnut Latte with a side of their blue berry pastry. Super moist, and not too sweet.

I enjoyed seeing the older men gathered at the front window all wearing fedora's. Talk about swag!! Although, I am a gold member at Starbucks, I instantly skipped over the one across the street. Bernie's is our Noe Valley favorite!!!!!
author: Tiffany M.

description: Needed a cozy, quiet cafe with reliable WiFi to spend a couple hours working and dog-sitting a naturally anxious canine. Bernie's: perfect. Dog loves the dog treats on the counter and I love the green tea and vegan snacks. We're both enjoying the music and friendly clientele.
author: Ivy E.

description: Friendly staff serving large cups of good coffee, good quiche, and sriracha sauce along with academic literature on the benefits of hot sauce. Open super early and a good spot with free wifi to work out of the house in Noe valley.
author: Sid M.

description: Stopped by here for our weekly Wednesday morning breakfast and it was just okay. We had the ham and cheese quiche and the spinach & bacon frittata. Neither was anything special, I wouldn't order either item again. We also had a caramel macchiato which was quite good. From our experience, you should come for the coffee but skip the savory food!
author: Kendra N.

description: The cappuccino I just got from here tasted so burned and disgusting, I just threw it in the trash.
author: Patricia D.

description: Warm, homey atmosphere, great coffee, and friendly people. A jewel of the Noe Valley neighborhood. Oh, and Bernie is awesome!
author: Chiara P.

description: Great neighborhood joint with good coffee and a local staff. Also a good place to work.
author: Rajhans S.

description:
If you want to be served by a Bitchy rude queen, then this is your place. I avoid Starbucks whenever possible and walked past one to patronize this place. I order a tall Americana and he said "We only have small and large". I said: "oh, I thought tall vs short had to do with how much water is in an Americana". He retorts: " We speak English here, not Starbucks!"
I ordered an Americana from my favorite coffee shops in the Financial (Cento, XTra, Vega, etc....) and they use that jargon. My point is: why be rude about it?!?! This is not how I wanted to start my morning. The place was empty compared to Starbucks across the street and I don't blame them! I'll support corporate coffee before I come back here!
author: Blixa S.

description: Diggin' it. My friend and I stopped in today to a grab a cup of coffee (very tasty) and stroll around 24th street. Love the location inside the Victorian home and very cozy, lots of snack options. Highly recommend.
author: Mel G.

description: Yum! Bernie makes great coffee and I forgot what I was going to say bc I never finished the review but this place was pretty awesome.
author: Andrew S.

description:
This is one of my neighborhood cafe and I'm definitely a cafe camper since I usually have some kind of reading/writing/laptop related work and cannot concentrate to work at home.

Bernie's is a cozy spot, decent food shelf (with a mix of savory and sweet things), and good coffee (overnight test: coffee not bitter if left overnight..okay..gross i know but that's how the test is done!). 

As it is in the heart of Noe, on the rare occasion, there will be a rambunctious kid or two. But my biggest complaint: sometimes, it can kind of smell like the bathroom. A door draft stopper maybe?

They make good use of the space and always have something delicious for you. Staff is nice and used to students and professionals working away. Thank you!
author: Christina H.

description:
3.5 Stars

This is a cute coffee shop next to Whole Foods in Noe Valley.  The seating options & free Wi-Fi are great.  My cafe au lait was perfect, but my husband's mocha was disappointing.  The cookies were very tasty though. I would come back if I was looking for a spot to work for a little while & was in the neighborhood.
author: Christy L.

description: Cute shop but rather pricey and no room to sit. Claiming "$" is not right...
author: Dahlia S.

description:
This is a fantastic coffeeshop!  Great coffee, great baristas, and such a friendly owner, who clearly cares about the quality of the coffee, the baked goods, and his cafe.

Since cafe's are all about coffee and baked goods, and they're so amazing, it's 5 stars all the way.

My only real complaint:  children.  I know, I know, it's not Bernie's fault.  Entitled Noe Valley parents with their monster asshole children like to come in here and cause a ruckous all the time.  I wish I could turn around and slap them.  

There's a sign in here that says Unattended Children will be given a Puppy and Espresso (i.e. control your fucking brats).  I wish this were better enforced.

:)
author: Michael D.

description:
Every morning, during my week-long stay in Noe.  Coffee and pastries were delicious.

I love being called "angel."

It sure helped the whole staying up late, but still waking early because I was on Chicago time.
author: Ellen M.

description: Bernie is sweeter than a honey hazelnut latte
author: Mr M.

description: I've been living in Noe Valley my entire life and Bernie's is, by far, my favorite coffee shop-- and that's saying a lot because we definitely have a lot of options over here! The staff is always friendly and welcoming, there is good work space, and the atmosphere is lighthearted and familial. I come almost every morning for a soy latte and an hour of work... This place is really starting to feel like home :)
author: Erica D.

description:
Oh Bernie's, how I love thee....your drip coffee and latte's are my favorite.
a true highlight in my day. love the staff and the overall vibe!
author: Jennifer K.

description: Short and sweet, this is a very chill, laid back neighborhood coffee shop where you'll often see the locals and their dogs just hanging around outside. I didn't have a dog or else I woulda have been there every Saturday morning as well. Overall, good wifi and mocha!
author: Neil I.

description: Love Bernie's.  Coffee is great along with the staff. Always my first stop when I come into the city.
author: Jim K.

description: If you enjoy enjoy coffee, stay away from this place. The barista was really nice,  but made a terrible latte with overheated milk.
author: Amin S.

description:
Super cute little coffee shop! 

We relocated our bookclub here one morning and sat at a nice little table, taking in all the niceness around us. Since I'm not a coffee drinker, I enjoyed a fizzy water and a scone. 

The lady at the counter was super pleasant and it seemed like a really nice place to sit for a while- either with a book, a newspaper, some work, a friend, or a scone. There's a cute little children's area as well.
author: Loli L.

description:
I miss living in Noe Valley in large part because of this coffee shop. Not only are the coffee and pastries excellent, the staff and Bernie herself are incredibly kind and gracious. 

Protip: skip the Starbucks on 24th, and support this awesome local business.
author: C P.

description:
My go-to place for caffeine.

Friendly barista, strong coffee, laid-back & unpretentious crowd, free wifi, cute decor, strategically located next to Whole Foods and in the heart of downtown Noe Valley.

Say hi to Ohla and Angel when you're there! They're the most amazing baristas.
author: Effie G.

description: Good spot for working mid-afternoon.  Not too loud...Not too quiet...
author: Kelvin B.

description: Great neighborhood coffee shop. My favorite place to sit down and do a little work for an hour or two.
author: Kyle G.

description: Really awesome coffee shop! The lattes were fantastic, the staff was friendly and the ambiance was quiet but still alive. It is a great place to work for the afternoon or just swing in for a quick drink or coffee date. Highly recommend.
author: Katherine D.

description: The malts and garlic parm fries are AWESOME! It can be frustrating to get a seat and service is sometimes slow but if you have the time to wait the food is worth it and consistently good.
author: Jenna A.

description: The staff immediately greeted us as we walked in and was VERY friendly throughout. There was a wonderful amount of items to choose from. We ordered a tea, hot cocoa, a quiche and a macaroon. The broccoli cheese quiche had a bit too much broccoli in my personal opinion but the macaroon was THE BEST I HAVE EVER HAD and I love macaroons. It was incredibly moist and the flavor...mmmmmm. I am so thankful I do not live near this place as i would be the macaroon hog and probably 500 lbs.  Great little shop.
author: Lena D.

description:
Local coffee shop in Noe Valley. Always passed by it as I walked around the area, but finally went in a couple of weeks ago. The coffee is quite nice, and they've got plenty of sitting room. A lot of people like to sit there and work, or read, so its not too noisy a place. They place some excellent music as well. 

The baristas are friendly, and check on you periodically to make sure you feel at home.
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
This is my neighborhood coffee shop and I love it! Great community energy with friendly staff. I do a lot of studying here and no one ever makes me feel bad for my 3rd refill (only $0.50) or my hours of occupying a table. There's always a dog to pet out front and 9 out of 10 times the music is AWESOME.

Come support this local business! Thanks Bernie!
author: Lauren R.

description:
Great coffee.... very nice shop, GREAT people serving you :) I like this place, and since they open the new grocery store on 24th ... you know... the famous one .... I always stop here for a hot coco before... or after my shopping. Yes... medium hot coco low fat milk with no whipped cream !!! LOVE IT!!

They have WiFi and if you really do not have a phone or a computer, you can sit down and check email from the desktop they have in the corner (have to pay for it).

Well done... love the armchairs in the window !!!
author: Gianguido G.

description:
What an intimate, kick back coffee shop Bernie's is.  I was going to Starbucks in Laurel Village to represent for World Wide Knit in Public week and found Bernie's advertised on Yelp.  I decided to go there since I knew the hood.
I ordered the biggest hot chocolate and a blackberry & peach scone.  Both were great!  The staff is SO friendly and cheerful as everyone's been reviewing.  I kept hearing the names Bernie and Ola so I'm curious on who they are and what they look like :O).
It was fun to criss cross applesauce in one of the big, wicker chairs in the front and knit Pashmina yarn!  It was funny to hear two senior men talk about their ailments.
author: Kekumukula N.

description:
Great coffee shop for doing work and studying.

Staff is vey friendly.

A bit cramped, but still a good space. Free Wifi.
author: Katherine O.

description:
If you're looking for a cozy coffee shop that has better atmosphere and drinks than the chain stores, you'll love it. If you're a die hard espresso snob, this might not be the place for you. 

I'm somewhere in between. 

The atmosphere is awesome and the staff is warm and friendly. Little cramped but comfortable. Almost feels like you're hanging out in someone's living room. There's no patio space outside for tables, so they have park benches instead. Good move.

For my double cappuccino the barista steamed up heaping loads of pillowy foam that stood above the edge of the glass. It's not the textured milk, like most indie shops do these days, and I like it. (I like both styles actually, they're both a treat for different occasions) 

The espresso itself was good, not great, but good. (This is where my snobbery starts to show) It was definitely better than the chain stores, but didn't have the deep and complex flavors that I normally prefer.

Lastly, as I sat outside on the park bench reading my book, I really appreciated how many of the customers seemed to know each other. It seemed like this was the spot for many of the locals to run into each other while on their daily thing. I like a place with a community.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
So i don't require much in a coffee shop. Ok, I lie, I'm picky and there's a specific list of requirements that must be met in order for me not to harangue it as a slinger of sour bean juice:

1) no overly perky staff at 6am
2) no celine dion
3) they know how to make a cappuccino with a stiff foam
4) no celine dion
5) no kenny g
6) no mermaid logos
7) the music is at a reasonable level and there's no kenny g and no celine dion
8) free wi-fi
9) dog friendly
10) did I mention the crap music?
11) good coffee

So far Bernie's has met all my requirements and I'll be heading back. The staff is pleasant without being overly saccharine which drives me bonkers when I still feel like the walking dead.
author: Len S.

description:
I'm always cruising for new coffee shops, and am a regular at Philz and Blue Bottle. After drinking individually-prepared cups of coffee, no shop that serves it by the pot can compare. Coffee oxidizes rapidly, and much like a sliced apple left outside for even a few minutes, loses its freshness immediately. A fresh pot of coffee tastes so much better because it is fresh.

Thus, Bernie's was just "Meh" for me.

If I were in the neighborhood and wanted a mochachino or something, maybe they'd suffice. I prefer drinking my coffee fresh, and without milk or sweeteners.
author: Michael C.

description:
It's all about Bernie.  This may seem obsequious, but Bernadette (yeah, her given name happens to be too long for the sign out front) is now pronounced by me to be one of San Francisco's royalty.  An order, for the first time, proffered by me in a most Yelperific fashion!  Go 'head, Queen Bernie.  I love what you're bringin', girlfriend!

It's really Bernadette's story to tell, I just happen to be sharing my side of it.  Way back in the last millennium, ('twas 1994), I was but a novice SF'ian, a former wanna-be now turned on by a his new, joy-filled reality...and in my new nabe of Noe, there was my fave java dispensary, Spinelli's...  I pause after I say the name, because it was a holy spot to me.  My favorite, I told you that already...

Now it's 2008...

Great beans, great coffee.  It's that simple, but there's something more...a brain behind it.  It belongs to our local Fly Girl, Bernie. 

She's warm-hearted, deep and fancy-free, the warm, personable Ms. Bernie.  I strolled in for the first time with the g'f and Bernadette offered us free pastry.  It was delicious, that lemon square, so sweet and tart...and the price was right.

I was happy to have been drawn in by the classy, classic sign bearing her name - not to mention the cool colors and warm woods somehow assuring me that I was in for tasty, great coffee.  And yes, there was reverie, more than a distant memory, as I approached the counter, I remembered dreams and fantasies of mine that had flown through Spinelli's.  No sooner than I mentioned this to smiling one behind the counter, did she tell me that she worked at ole Spinelli's back in the day.  And after the owner sold to Tully's, she stayed.  Then she set across the country opening Tully's stores for a few years.  Always staying in touch with the Spinelli's fella, btw...

Sacred, that space on 24th...Bernie put everything she had into ensuring that this would remain a coffee shop...and she's elevated it to a coffee shrine.  I dare say far better than ever.

Oh my, my reverie has returned...it's warm mochas, sunshine and petting/sharing dogs left in my care by neighborhood friends-turned-Cala-shoppers for just a few warm, happy minutes. Praise Jah, Bernie made it happen.  

Wi-fi, a great staff, free magazines and a clean restroom count for a lot - 5 stars already!  But there's so much else.

Up at 4:30 to get the coffee brewed for you.  Still cheery late in the afternoon.  THAT'S BERNIE!

Love her "ecotainer" brand compost-able cups made from 100% renewable resources. 

The coolest, fun in the sun, or inside spot.? Bernie's, yo!!!!!!!!!!!!!

HELLO caffeine-head, WAKE UP ALREADY, get your java on...zoom don't creep to BERNIE'S!
author: Ted R.

description:
I really want to support the only non-chain coffee shop in Noe Valley, but Bernie's isn't making it very easy for me. A friend and I were there and I asked politely if I could close the door to which the barista said yes. The other employee working continued to open the door on the 50 degree evening and commented rudely and loudly about it. 

Not to mention their drinks are less than stellar. As a result, I've succumbed to the draw of the Starbucks across the street where the service is always polite and the air temperature bearable. They do have free wi-fi and many outlets... so that's where they got some stars.
author: Thea Z.

description: Bakery case looks amazing. Coffee here is about .30 more than starbucks and tastes about .30 better. $3 minimum. Good wifi. Lots of shared tables to work and chairs to read. Benches outside.
author: Will D.

description: Bernie her self is an amazing woman and runs a fantastic shop. This place makes the neighborhood. Thanks for running such a great place Bernie!
author: Ryan B.

description: Friendly staff.  Great place to work. Lots of coffee drink options. Easy Noe Valley street parking.
author: Alias A.

description:
I'm a fan. I find the owner to be super nice, sweet *not like splenda, more like raw sugar* someone you feel good about patronizing.

Decent coffee to go, but I'm spoiled with french drip, which I reckon is available here (serves 2, btw)

Cute place, homey but without the doilies

Locals on laptops, great sitting area outside to boot

If there were more Bernie's on the Peninsula, I'd never have to walk into another Starbucks again.

:)
author: Athena S.

description:
We have been going there since they opened.  The coffee crew is great and very approachable & easy to converse with the crew (low countertop).  

This is the best coffee place in the City!!!!
author: Kelly G.

description: A local coffee shop -- they must be, their sign says it! Better-than-Starbucks coffee. Cozy little joint.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Coffee was smooth and didn't leave bad after taste, but lack of strength.  Maybe that's why they ask if I would like to add a shot.  Well I think for a small drink already costs more than 3 bucks, I shouldn't have to pay anything extra just to make it stronger when it should've been strong enough.  
The cashier was friendly, and I love that they have several benches outside so I can take my dog there too.
author: Tadaa T.

description: Beautiful photographs/paintings hung around the white walls. Kid friendly place. While it's a cozy space to converse with friends or to work at, the latte and pie I got there was disappointing. Both items (pumpkin latte and berry pie) were lacking in taste. Not much flavor going on in either. Pie was really small. Pricy as well.
author: C. C.

description:
I love everything about this place. The atmosphere, food, coffee and wonderful staff. Every time I come in, I'm happily greeted at the counter by just about everyone who works there. It really makes a difference in your day (especially early in the morning!) when you're ordering coffee to go and the staff is so up beat and happy. 

I'd recommend their breakfast sandwiches, and if you're a coffee lover like I am then this is definitely the right place for you. (They have dog treats for pets too). Simply the best in Noe Valley!
author: Katie S.

description: Great place for espresso!! super clean and nice. Great service!
author: Drew N Chelsea R.

description: Bernie's is a quaint coffee shop located next the Whole Foods on 24th street in now valley. The location is prime and the coffee is amazing. Whether you want a cup of coffee or a latte, Bernie's does not disappoint. It is very busy but worth the wait!
author: Amber B.

description: Cute shop and all, but the Honey Hazelnut Latte (I ordered it as a cappucino) is pretty unappetizing. It's the first time for me to try this, but it tastes peppery and fishy to me... I wouldn't reccomend that one
author: Alice R.

description:
Bernie's not only has great coffee but is an airy, friendly, comfortable place to meet friends or work. The place buzzes with friendly cheers from the staff to locals -- often greeting them by name. 

Delicious pastries and a nice airy ambiance make this one of my favorite cafes in the city. In short: It has great energy.
author: Susie W.

description: Good coffee shop although nothing really stood out...
author: Tiff W.

description: I used to like come here once in awhile but after seeing what I saw today-I will spend my money elsewhere. When I was drinking my mocha, I overheard the manager and employees talk about customers and other people. Ok.. in this economy people are struggling and if we spend money at your business-wouldn't it be nice to act as if you appreciate everyone who comes into your cafe? For businesses to act like this makes me mad because they obviously are only thinking of the money rather than the people.
author: Robin S.

description:
This is a great neighborhood coffee joint and I'm lucky it happens to be in my neighborhood.  The drinks are quickly made and delicious.  The vibe is just super cute and friendly.
My sole complaint is that the staff can be really loud when they're all chatting with each other. On the other hand, at least they're happy and not cranky.
author: Marissa B.

description:
I'm found my new tea spot. I don't drink coffee all that often anymore, but I've had a shot of espresso here and a mocha so I can testify to the quality there as well. All the fixings for your everyday indie coffee shop in San Francisco including delicious pastries and other treats, but the staff is what brings me back since I work on 24th.

Warm atmosphere here, free wi-fi, good place to get things done or relax just the same.

Make sure you meet Bernie, she's a sweetheart!
author: Daniel K.

description:
Service as sugary sweet as your triple-shot .caramel-swirl, white-chocolate-mocha infused steamy latte (extra whip).

The lovely ladies pulling your shots dish it out and it's not the sickeningly sweet, artificial french vanilla either. This is the real deal. They know their customers and if they don't, they'll make you feel like home anyway.

I'm not too keen on the coffee but there's enough charm to keep me coming back for more... more like a cuppa tea and a pastry (which are free after 7:30pm, FYI. Hook it up! ) Free wi-fi and a mellow vibe if you're in it for the late-night (not) at the office.
author: Alissa A.

description: It was my first time at this location. Bernie was kind, her staff was helpful, and my drink was just as it should be. This is one locally owned business that I'm happy to support.
author: Alex O.

description:
I have a slight fascination with men in uniforms, well not uniform (s) but a specific type. So when I walked in to Bernies to get a coffee, sure enough I was surrounded by firefighters. Everywhere. I saw the trucks drive down the street and figured a station was close but who knows, who cares. They were there for their coffee and if there's firefighters well then damn. Who doesn't love guys...and girls (to be PC) who climb up trees and save kittens, help little old ladies cross the street and hose down burning buildings when the call comes in. 

Right, focus. This is about coffee. I ordered an americano (after the firefighters of course) and waited....and waited....and waited (which really wasn't all that long). I think the crew lost my cup or maybe there wasn't a cup made. I don't know but somehow it got lost and a lady behind the counter, maybe the manager asked what I ordered and quickly got the drink going. Had this been a morning where I was running late or whatever maybe I would have said something but because of those damn men in their blues we're even steven.

The vibe is uber relaxed and inviting, there's even computers in the back. It's a neighborhood coffee house and it's comforting to know that people all know each other and have a power chat before walking out on their separate ways. Thank goodness I ate breakfast otherwise I may have been tempted by some of the pastries behind the counter or the miniature pumpkin cupcakes that looked moist and delicioso.

I thanked the staff again for getting the drink out when I left and the not too hot coffee did its job perfectly. Excellent and attentive service, a delightful down home place to snag some coffee-and some eye candy.
author: Morgan M.

description:
While in San Francisco on vacation, we stayed in Noe Valley.
Bernie's was our choice for coffee in the morning.
They pull a nice cafe mocha and their flavored coffees are tasty without being overly sweet.
We tried a couple of their pastries and enjoyed everything.
We'll make a return visit to Bernie's the next time we're in town.
author: Mark B.

description:
I'm writing from Bernie's right now.  The best part about Bernie's seems to be how friendly the place is--from the staff down to the customers it just feels like a really friendly, happy place.  Not too crowded and not too sparse.  Possibly because it's hidden up in the hills, it gets a pure neighborhood vibe, lacking the transcience and casual unfriendliness that tourists generate. (Alot of my cafe time is spent down on the Haight, where most of the patrons on a given day are tourists.)

And the coffee is good--the baristas are proud of their profession.
author: Maxine M.

description: Super institution. There were teammates at the business meeting. All were satisfied. Service is excellent. Absolutely not intrusive, we had need. Would recommend. Next time better rasprobuem kitchen, everything else on top. Just want to share positive emotions with respect to coffee. He was a great and strong as possible, the supply is excellent. Thank you staff!
author: Andrey G.

description: Best coffee I've ever had.  They make a great iced mocha and the breakfast burritos are good.  This is a cute & cozy coffee stop in the heart of Noe Valley.  Bernie and Dennis are the best.  I will always come here to get my morning fix!
author: Karin E.

description: For a great CUPPA .....not only are the coffee, barristas and barristos (is there such a thing?) and atmosphere better, so is the pricing!  And how often do you buy an espresso from the actual STORE OWNER who works it just about every day.  This is what local businesses are about!
author: Victoria K.

description:
Bernie's just keeps getting better!
They now have very RELIABLE Internet access, including encrypted, secure access that costs a few bucks. Starbucks requires you to buy Internet access (AT&T). Bernie's lets you choose between free and premium service. Plus the coffee is so much better at Bernie's.
author: Kevin D.

description:
Bernie's prides itself on being a local coffee shop. I love supporting the independents. Situated on the ground floor of a green painted Victorian, Bernie's has a very chill relaxed vibe. A smattering of little round tables were occupied by laptop toting Noe-ites (free wi-fi) and sipping their coffees. 

I tried the iced coffee (small was around $1.85) which was fine. Definitely freshly brewed but it's the mix your own cream and sugar deal. They did have nice full cans of half and half, and honey and liquid sugar options, which was nice.

Bernie's is a little dark in the back of the store and like most of SF does not have air conditioning. You have to dress for it.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Great place for a little cup of sunshine!  The owner and staff seem to greet everyone, regulars and wide-eyed newbie's alike, with open arms.  Being new to Noe, this welcoming spot, with sweet pastries and warm house-blend chai, made me feel like I was in my grandmother's kitchen.

Bernie's has character and a local, community feel about it.  Photographs from a local artist fill the walls.  Locally-made honey (from a few blocks away on Dolores St.) is offered for sale.  A book that apparently was partly written at the shop is on display.  And, my personal favorite: a sign stating that "unattended children will be given a shot of espresso and a free puppy."   

In addition to the social atmosphere, this is a great spot to work or study.  Unlike so many coffee shops, the wifi is FREE here.  Plus, you can almost always find a seat - at one of the tables, comfortable chairs, or on one of the benches outside to watch people passing by.  Inside, you'll overhear intriguing conversations.  Last week, some very cool Teach for America teachers were planning their curriculum.  

This independent coffee house rivals the Starbucks across the street.  There was a full house when I stopped by in yesterday's downpour - many loyal locals, including this new one!

ps. If you happen to be there around closing time, you'll get your choice of leftover goodies to go.
author: Heather W.

description: I really love this coffee shop. It's minimally dimmed and always puts me in the mood to get work done. I usually stay at Bernie's for almost three hours every time I go. The baristas are super friendly and chill. The owner, Bernie, is usually there before closing time and engages with the customers. The ONE and ONLY thing I dislike about Bernie's is that they close at 7PM :(
author: Joseph P.

description:
The coffee here is fantastic.  Really tasty and caffeinated.  It's a great place to sit and work or watch people go by--if you can find a place to sit.  A lot of the times if I need a seat to do some work I pop my head in, see nowhere to sit, and have to go elsewhere.

There is free wifi but it gives you a warning that it's not secure and you need to pay for secure service.  Not sure what the deal is but so far my identity seems to be safe.  

The staff is happy and cheerful.  But the downside to a neighborly place is that it's a bit clubby, and they will often chat with the "regulars" even while ringing up someone else.  

But gotta come back for the coffee and the happy mood.
author: Rebecca L.

description: The coffee is good, definitely better than Starbucks.  I have found only personable person on staff is the Batista, she is a African American woman that really likes people, smiles and makes great coffee (she gets 5 stars)  I have gone twice and barely anyone acknowledges you,  I get tired of the clique of the salty cranky cafe staff or bartenders, smile life isn't that bad. Especially in the Noe Valley, I expect a friendlier happier staff.
author: Loretta M.

description:
Sat up shop in this place on a sunny Sunday afternoon. Their baristas are incredibly friendly, made our drinks super promptly, and were talkative and nice during the entire stay.

Free wi-fi, a few plugs, and it wasn't very crowded?  Yes, please.
author: Adam T.

description:
I love this place.  the owner is a doll who treats all her customers as friends, and always remembers what you get.  Their coffee is very good and they make yummy coffee concoctions as well.  My most charming experience was one morning when I walked in to see a huge line.  I did not want to wait to order as I needed to get to work.  The next time I went in, Bernie told me she had seen me and had started making my caramel latte as soon as she had seen me, but I left before she got my attention.  I never walk out when its busy anymore.

Bernie's has a real neighborhood feel.  It's a good place to catch up on local news.  I have been making coffee at home a lot recently, but I always go there when I want a special treat.

I just updated my review to 5 stars because, what was I thinking? I love this place!  So friendly and such a nice, neighborhood feel.  It is really the only place I go out for coffee anymore.
author: Liz R.

description: Excellent pastries, kind staff, open at 5:30am! Perfect for those early mornings when I run out of coffee beans or half & half...
author: icka b.

description:
So they have these amazing little frosted donuts and weirdly delicious scones -- higher quality and better selection than any other coffee shop in the neighborhood, in your opinion.

And you know that nobody's perfect. You know that people who work in restaurants and coffee shops make unsanitary decisions sometimes. You know this because you've gone to the restroom somewhere and there's no soap in the dispenser, and you deduced that the employees--at least for a certain amount of time--have not been washing their hands after they pee pee (or worse, poo poo).  You know this, and yet you eat out anyway, because most of the unsanitary things that happen aren't going to harm you much, if at all, and anyway, do you want to be holed up in your house all day? You have to relax. 

And yet, when you stop by Bernie's on your way home from work for some little iced donuts, and no one is behind the counter, but then someone walks in carrying a just-emptied trashcan, and then is very friendly as he asks what he can get for you, you think to yourself, "Is he going to wash his hands?"

And when he doesn't, you wonder if he realizes that you saw him walk in with a just-emptied trash can. You offer to let the woman next to you order first, thinking that surely he'll wash his hands before he actually begins to prepare her order, in which case all of this internal monologue has been for naught, but when she orders and he puts his trashcan hands all over her cup and the various utensils he's using to prepare her drink, you walk out of the coffee shop, and for the past few weeks, you can think of nothing but trashcan hands when you walk by.

And the little frosted donuts wait for you to forget all about it and come on back.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Visited Bernie's recently while exploring gorgeous Noe Valley and was definitely impressed with this place. The staff was quite friendly and attentive (in a genuine way) and the cafe was warm and welcoming. I ordered a skim latte and a giant chocolate croissant, which were both delicious (the latte was well crafted and the croissant ... well, who doesn't like croissants + chocolate?!). Everything was priced very reasonably (the croissant seemed cheaper than I would have expected) and everything was fresh and satisfying. The ambiance was very cozy and comfortable - my only critique (and reason for giving Bernie's 4 stars) is that the lighting was surprisingly dim ... in other words, it could possibly be hard to come here to read / study unless you managed to grab a table by the window (of which there are 2, plus 2 armchairs). 

All in all, definitely a place I'd visit again, and one worth trying out if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Rishi N.

description:
Bernie's is a great local coffee shop with quality coffee and friendly employees. 

My wife and I walk our dog in the mornings and head over to Bernie's for our coffee fix. We get our coffee and our dog gets a dog treat, which they usually have out by the barista. 

The park benches out front are a great place to sit and enjoy a morning coffee before the craziness of the work day.
author: Bill P.

description:
I CANNOT get an iced decaf coffee in this town -- everyone tries to give me espresso plus water. When I want an iced latte, I get an iced latte. When I want regular ol' iced coffee, I'm basically fucked. 

After a trip back east during which I drank copious amounts of Dunkin' Donuts decaf iced coffee, I was going through withdrawal here. I was seriously considering opening a DD franchise.

Then I went to Bernie's.
"Do you do decaf iced coffee?"
"Yup."
"Do you have it every day?"
"Course we do."

And it was DELICIOUS. Just as good as all the DD's I drank back east.

And it was $1.75 for a huge vat of it.

Bernie's is my new favorite nabe coffee place!
author: Brooke H.

description:
This little store front has gone through so many incarnations, I can hardly keep track anymore.  I believe there was a Spinelli's coffee shop here at one point, and then a Peet's.  But now, lovely Bernie has moved in, and from the looks of it, she has no plans on moving out.  Good on her!

This comfy little coffee shop fits in perfectly with Noe Valley's laid back, family style attitude.  It's a welcome addition to 24th Street.  

Friendly baristas and decent coffee also round out the equation.  Add some wireless Internet and you've got a bonafide gem of a hangout.  Whenever I'm out fighting the strollers and nannies in the hood and in the mood for a de-caf tea or hot chocolate, Bernie's is the first place I visit.

I don't drink coffee, btw.  The reason:  I'm naturally super-hyper, and would like to keep my friends.
author: Kristina R.

description:
Support your local coffee shop
To it you must hop hop
Don't let nearby Starbucks be Daddy Warbucks
For sure, this place is like a precious raindrop

The sticky tables are sometimes a dash wanting
But don't let that you be a daunting
For Bernie's is really the Bert to your Ernie
author: Katie T.

description:
Bernie's has all the elements of a great coffee shop.  What are these elements?  
- good coffee
- good food
- comfortable atmosphere, that supports conversing with other humans and/or sitting down with your laptop and working
- it isn't too crowded, but has enough people flowing in and out to maintain a suitable level of energy

On top of all that, Bernie is super cool which makes this an overall great place to get coffee at.
author: Larry M.

description: Bernie's is the perfect neighborhood cafe. The coffee is strong, pastries a-plenty and smiles unlimited.  They have a little kid area with toys that are educational an actually clean!  Best yet, they open at 5:30am so it's the perfect place to go to get your caffeine on when your 1 year old needs to be swept away before he wakes the older kids!
author: krystin k.

description:
In the high-stakes battle for cutest Noe Valley coffee shop (yes, high-stakes--the winner gets all that disposable income from the $1000 stroller crowd), Bernie's definitely wins on the exterior facade, although the disappointingly minimalist interior loses out to Martha & Bros.  Either way, there was no better spot to try out my new "coffee jacket" I got for Christmas (with my hair stylishly unkempt, of course). 

The important thing is it's staffed by some mellow peeps brewing up some mellow (but unimpeachable) lattes.  And there's hats proclaiming the (unconfirmed) existence of an Elizabeth Street Brewery (really?!?).
author: Wes M.

description: In a town filled with great cafes, unfortunately this is not one of them. Bernie herself is friendly and feisty, but the space is dark, the music is usually terrible, and the coffee is bitter: tastes like 1980's finest. Great location, but much better neighborhood coffee options at Philz, Spin City, even La Boulange and (gasp) Starbucks.
author: tw s.

description:
I love Bernie's - it's a true addition to the neighborhood and of course I love that Bernie is from these parts. 

The coffee is great and everyone that works here is really nice - you genuinely feel like the people who are working there are all "neighbors". 

It's one of the only coffeehouses where I actually leave a tip. Never mind what that might say about me - just go drink the coffee!
author: Shal J.

description: Before Bernie's, I was loyal to Martha Brothers.   However, once I had a chance to experience Bernie's, I quickly switched allegiances.  Bernie's is the model of a what a neighborhood coffee shop should be.  Since opening a little over 3 years ago, Bernie has built a loyal following of customers who come for the excellent coffee and -- almost as important -- the warm reception of Bernie and her staff.  They know their customers by name (as well as their beverages of choice) and treat them like family.   While I'm not able to make it here every single morning for my coffee (most mornings, but not all), without fail I always leave in a good mood.  Bernie's is in an integral part of the Noe community -- hopefully it will remain that way for years to come.
author: Andrew E.

description:
What a great addition to the neighborhood! I was getting a little fed up with my local coffee shop options until Bernie's opened up. Martha Bros is laughably inconsistent and my latte is always really bitter from the coffee being burned or exposed to the air. Starbucks is just lame. But Bernie's is great! 

I was in there the other day and decided to try a mocha. Bernie asked me if I wanted whipped cream. I said yes. She stared at me for a moment and then said "I was waiting for that". She turned to the barista and asked for a mocha "with fun". It was a silly moment but it's great that the staff has fun while they work. The mocha came out great. Best coffee shop in Noe Valley hands down.
author: Aaron V.

description:
I really really want to love Bernie's. Heck, she is one of the few local cafes in the hood and I want to support her.  My biggest gripe is that the coffee drinks lack the taste of her competitors.  Maybe her Barista's need a little more training on the equipment, but I can swear that the drinks are just a little too watery compared to some "other" cafes down the street.  

There also seems to be a rule that even in the dead of winter (when it is rainy and windy) you can't close the door. Why? not sure, but it makes for a less than inviting atmosphere.

The staff is friendly and I will continue to support Bernie, but in a blind taste test her coffee drinks are a bit underwhelming.  I wish it wasn't so Bernie!!!
author: Joseph S.

description:
Noe Valley's 24th Street is much like Sesame Street.  I wave to the Martha's Coffee dude and my cleaner lady almost everyday, the children and pregnant people outnumber everyone else.  I overhear people calling it Nosy Valley who've lived here too long.... it's a great little village community.

Bernie's coffee shop is 'a local girl's coffee shop.'  It used to be a Tully's and this cute little blonde girl bought the shit out of it, and turned it into her dream coffee place with WIFI, a kids corner, a sunny window nook, and cute benches out front.  Bernie is always there of course, and it truly seems like all of the baristas are happy and enjoy working there.

The coffee is strong!  The cups are all compostable!  I need caffeine in the morning any way you toss it - I know that I'll go back here because I can tell they want me to.  That's a good feeling.
author: Kelly H.

description:
This is a great neighborhood coffee place.  
Prices are the same as Sbux, but the coffee is great, the atmosphere is nice and the employees (including Bernie) are super sweet.  
I'm a fan!
author: Christine M.

description:
This is a gem in Noe Valley. The coffee and lattes here are absolutely satisfying. The latte is no less than BBC and it's just so smooth when you sip it. I enjoy the homie feel on a cloudy day in the city. Cozy and cute. It's my favorite coffee shop here!

p.s. Don't forget their chocolate dipped short bread cookie! Pairs perfectly with their lattes!
author: Lynn C.

description:
Bernie's is down the block from my last apartment, and I am sad that it's now an up-hill bike ride to visit cute little Bernie and her people... I like Bernie's. A lot.  The coffee, the scones, the service-- all totally top-notch.  

But.

It features the triumverate of Noe Valleyism:
- Strollers the size of shopping carts;
- Artfully dressed Mac users sitting at tables in front of their computers, not really doing anything;
- Lard-assed middle aged women with poorly behaved lapdogs  jeopardizing the benches out front ALL. DAY. LONG.

I avoid this insanity by taking my coffee to go; skipping the atmosphere all together.   Given that there are 2 perfectly good cofffee places en route from my new place to Bernie's... I probably won't make it back with any regularity.
author: Laura F.

description:
Once a cafe called Spinell's then to Tully's at this location...NOW, it is Bernie's. I am never let down by the quality of coffee here. It is really wonderful and being in Noe Valley, it has that neighborhood cafe feel to it. Which I think almost everyone looks for in a cafe. "Somewhere, where everyone knows their name and they're always glad you came."

I know the owner personally, and she is such a ray of sunshine. She always has that award winning smile on her face, which is part of her charm. She is personable and when you meet her, you cannot help but want to come back and support the Local Coffee Houses of San Francisco. Mainly, this one!
author: John C.

description:
Ironically, Bernie's was recommended to me by a women I met at the Home Depot in Daly City.  When she found out I lived in Noe Valley, she suggested I check it out (quite a reputation).  It was a great suggestion.

Their drinks are well made, the Baristas are friendly, atmosphere is perfect for people watching, reading or working, and you can't beat the location (on 24th street).  This has become a default hang out for me when I feel like getting out of my apartment  to read or work on my laptop.

To top off all of that, it's locally owned!  Definitely worth a try...
author: Dwight B.

description:
Walking in to this place is like walking in to a Noe Valley stereotype.  There's a little section for kids with a chalkboard and scribbly drawings from kids with java-addicted parents who make them hang out in Bernie's.  There are always at least 2-3 dogs outside, at least one of which has the look that it's been abandoned because its owner (excuse me, it's "human companion") left them outside for 5 whole minutes.  Everyone has some obnoxious order like a triple pump extra hot nonfat macchiato or some dumb shit like that (my large soy iced mocha, however, is by no means "dumb shit").

Bernie herself is super cool and treats both her staff and customers well.  Apparently she used to be a manager at Peet's and bought this place when they didn't renew the lease.  Smart move, Bernie.  Peet's wasn't going to survive across the street from Starbuck's, but an INDEPENDENT coffee shop was destined to thrive in Noe Valley...especially since the next-closest one is a whole block and half away.
