Inside Bernie's you'll be treated to typical Noe conversations by pretentious do-gooders who speak loudly specifically because they want you to overhear them talk about mortgage rates, their child's grade school honors classes, their sex change operation and/or hormone therapy, etc.  You'll also see lots of Red Sox hats and heather socks with sandals, further proving my theory that Noe is a refugee camp for New England transplants.  You'll probably also see a newly transplanted New Englander talking about what a wonderfully open-minded city San Francisco is, clearly not yet jaded by the sad reality that we're all close-minded liberals.

When I was in there a couple of weeks ago I overheard said New Englanders talking about their friend (who had a very Jewish-sounding name like Sarah Silverman or something like that) who was a documentary filmmaker who used to work at WGBH (the local PBS affiliate in Boston) and just moved out here to work at Apple (got tired of low PBS documentary pay and sold out for the big bucks).  It also means that Sarah Silverman (or whatever her real name is) is most likely a lesbian.  Noe + PBS + Jewish = lesbian.  This conversation alone cemented all my Noe stereotypes.  See my review of the 24th Street Cheese Shop for further proof.

Oh yeah - the coffee's pretty good here, too.
author: Doctor L.

description:
So fantastic! I walked into Bernie's after a particularly tough therapy session. The barista was so sweet and welcoming, my mood brightened instantly. And a large steamed cup of nonfat milk w/sugar-free vanilla was only a) $2.50 and b) so tasty me wonders whether she "switched" my order to sugar because she thought I could use somethng sweet. I'm not a control freak, so I don't mind the extra mothering. 

Then I realized that the kind barista was none other than Bernie herself! How cool is that?
author: Suzanne R.

description: I'm in love with Bernie's! They make the foamiest, yummiest, most delicious latte in Noe--I've tried 'em all--and make me feel good about sticking it to the man (Starbucks).
author: Jen H.

description:
Bernie's brings me great solace.  

Seven years of Seattle gloom have left me pale, weak, and riddled with an insatiable craving for hot, inky, liquid caffeine delivered speedily and skillfully in a friendly neighborhood cafe.  Quality matters.  Maybe I've had bad luck,  but two months of sampling San Francisco's mom & pop coffee shops have left me cold, shaky, and unsatisfied.

And along comes Bernie.  Her coffee is fantastic, her baristas are first-rate, her space is wonderfully convivial and sunny, and *she* is warm, friendly, and funny.  I hope she stays in business until she's 100.  Or until I am.  

Did I mention that refills are free?  They are.  Did I mention that wireless is free?  It  is.  Plus, they don't give you a dirty look when you open a laptop.  All this makes me order MORE, not less, because really...I want Bernie's to stay in business forever.
author: Heather P.

description:
At first I was pretty damn wary of this place due to the proprietor's seemingly unfailing burning need to get all up in my business by asking such pointed questions as: "How are you doing?" and "What are you up to today?"  

But then, I found out about how Bernie was an old employee of Tully's (the previous occupant of said establishment), and she bought the coffee shop to spread her own bubbly brand of frontier java to the dour dog watchers and somnambulant soccer moms of Noe Valley. Yes, it's true folks; I did the leg work. I read the sign on the wall, and then I craftily asked the blond lady who seemed most likely to run for city council if her name was, in fact, Bernie.
And let me tell you... 

The story checks out.

Local girl makes good... cup of coffee.
News at eleven.
author: Rio R.

description:
If you find yourself on 24th street in Noe valley, please get your coffee here, and not at Bigbucks.
Bernie is always perky (even very, very early in the morning) and the coffee is really, really good. They make the effort, and they take very good care of you, in your dire caffeine addiction.
Local vs. global.
C'mon....what more do you need people?
author: Linda F.

description:
Bernie's coffe rocks.  Bernie the owner is a moist muffin of a girl...  wonder if she's into girls ever.......?

love that place and her 

P
author: Pammy S.

description: Went today, asked for my cafe au lait in a ceramic cup not takeout.  The two baristas were way too busy talking to their friends to wash the dishes THAT SAT ON THE COUNTER.  They both argued with each other constantly. MISS!
author: Alice H.

description: Bernie excellent Iced Coffee better than most! Trust when I say no bitterness or after taste, yuck! Just wholesome coffee goodness by a local San Franciscan, Thank you Bernie fantastic customer service as well!
author: Jennifer M.

description: I'm so glad Noe has this local coffee shop. Bernie is an absolute gem - she really cares about her customers, gets to know them, and creates a wonderful cozy environment for them. The staff are also fantastic - always warm and welcoming. I've also never had my drinks ready so fast! On more than one occasion, I walked to the counter, ordered and paid, and the drink was ready once I walked over to the other end of the counter to pick it up.
author: Leila A.

description: I just love everything about this place. The staff is friendly and efficient and the lattes are great.  Food is local and tasty.  I don't know why you would go anywhere else on 24th st.
author: Amy H.

description:
Best coffee in the 'hood (assume the position, Martha and your Brothers. Go away and die, S'bucks).

Best place to sit and sip in the 'hood. Free WiFi -- in the 'hood.

Or ok, it's in Noe, so there's lots of moms, kids, and dogs (all of whom are richer than me, even the dogs). No so much the 'hood at all. 

But it is independently owned, free of worthless shitty 'tude, and they'll remember your name, top off your cup, and from time to time give you free stuff like brownies and cookies. 

Thank you, Bernie's. We love you.
author: Chris R.

description: This is a fantastic spot to settle in for a few hours on a laptop, get your caffeine and feel good about your day. The staff is super friendly and don't mind you asking for coffee refills. Yea, Bernie knows what she's doing.
author: jason h.

description:
here are their hours:
m-sa 530a-8p
sun 530a-7p

i just called and had to find out. 

bernie's is a hub for noe valley.  she and her staff are very friendly, kind and whip up drinks quickly. 

there's a communal table in a addition to a few small tables and benches outside. 

it's the coziest cafe on 24th, for sure.
author: Michelle M.

description:
I'd been to Bernie's three or four times before, but I hadn't chimed in with a review of my own because she was already getting such good press, and I didn't want *everyone* to start going there.  But I've got to tell you about what happened tonight.

I left the house at 7:52 with a fussy shrieking baby, thinking the walk might soothe Mini-Me and a hot drink might soothe my frayed nerves.  I got to Bernie's right as they were locking the door.

Not only did Bernie unlock the door and offer to fix me something...
...she remembered I like my steamed milk nonfat,
...she remembered that my baby has a reflux disorder,
...and she wouldn't let me pay for my drink tonight.

So I left with a comforting pat on the back, a warm drink in my hand, and a smile on my face.  I am so glad Bernie and her crew have set up shop in the neighborhood!
author: Hypercycloid ..

description: This is a place I like going after I go to Whole Foods. The people who work there are pretty nice and the coffee is great!! Even when the line is long the wait is short.  Bernie is the prettiest coffee shop owner around! I wonder if she's single ; )
author: David W.

description:
Ok, when was the last time Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz served you a double non-fat mocha hold the whip that he actually made from scratch? The question is -  does he even know what button to push on their pre-programmed espresso machine that will create the same cup of Joe no matter which domestic or international location you purchased it from.  

So that is why Bernie's is so damn special.  Not only does the actual owner, CEO, whatever you want to call her (Bernadette) actually staffs her establishment, she also knows how to make a good cup of coffee no matter how fancy you want it.  And she has that special talent of being friendly to her customers no matter how cranky they might be prior to their caffeine fix.  Sadly, Martha of Martha & Bros just down the street can't claim that.  

Thank you Bernie for being an actual original on 24th Street.
author: Rebecca G.

description: Been a local in Noe for over 10 years, and Bernie is one of the people who makes it a great place to live. She runs an old-fashioned kind of place, where you come to hang out, chat with the staff (friendly, efficient, and stable), drink a great cup of joe, and watch the world go by. Bernie makes each and everyone feel special. Her and her coffee shop are a local treasure. Go, and have an Americano on me. :-)
author: K M.

description:
Chain coffee shops do not appeal to me. My fiance and I love discovering new neighborhood coffee shops and imagine the surprise when we found Bernie's. 

After a day of shopping jaunts from the Haight to Hayes to Noe Valley, headaches set in and we needed a boost. The omni-present Starbucks was an easy fix, but we felt like we would be cheating our own quest to find a good cup o'joe. 

Serndipitously, we stumbled upon Bernie's - awwww, the feeling of walking into a calm coffee shop and finding an extensive and enticing beverage list.

SCORE - we found a drink that calls our name and does it so successfully, we make the journey from Benicia to Noe Valley to satiate that coffee yearning. 

Honey Hazelnut Latte - I feel that yearning coming along....
author: April D.

description:
I had coffee at 4pm and couldn't sleep until 3am. So, it is strong enough. 

I prefer it to Martha's, it is superior to Starbuck's (even McDonald's coffee beats Starbuck's)  but when I am feeling really in need, I trek to Philz.

The outdoor seating is a bench great for people watching.
author: Katherine B.

description:
Wow, after reading the reviews before me I had to check to make sure I was Yelping the same place because I had a different experience at Bernie's than everyone else here.  Which totally bums me because I walked in loving the decor, the indoor/outdoor seating, and the location, and the fact that they have a "local girl" motto - GO LOCAL GIRL!

But unfortunately the coffee we had that day we were in there, 3/30/08, SUCKED big time, it was totally burnt!  I was so sad, hoping that maybe it was my own taste buds that were off, so I reality checked with my guy asking him how he liked the coffee, he said "It's burnt", and he's drinks a lot of coffee so he knows burnt coffee when he tastes it.  We could not even finish our cups, ended up throwing it away.  

I was waffling between 2 and 3 stars because of all I loved about this place, but what it comes down to is that this is a coffee place, and as I said the coffee that day was horrible, so until I go back and can actually get fresh coffee it will be 2 stars for now.
author: Victoria M.

description:
I just moved to Noe Valley, and within one week Bernie made me feel like a local. She knew my drink, asked about my move, inquired how I like the neighborhood, and generally was very welcoming and kind. 

In addition, the coffee is really good!!! Sometimes there are cute, neighborhood coffee houses, but the coffee just sucks. Not here! I enjoy it just as much as my other fave, Peets! 

It's really fun to hang out in there and just watch the dynamics between the regulars. People do a lot of work from here, and a lot of community groups seem to have their meetings here. Also, there's usually some super cute dogs tied up outside :)

Snacks are good too!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
A great addition to 24th Street.  

Although Bernie has been a part of 24th Street for years - with the flowerstand that was once across the street, to being a manager at the Tully's.  It is so good to see her in her own business there!
LOCAL GIRL MAKES GOOD!!!!

The coffee is EXCELLENT, but the atmosphere is even more EXCELLENT.  Bernie, Debbie, Dennis and all the baristas are smiling, attentive, and effecient.  The setting is friendly and warm, welcoming to adults and kids. Bernie did such a wonderful redesign. (Even the  bathroom, which was just frightening when Tully's had this location, is now clean,& well stocked.)

I used Bernie's recently to supply coffee for a fundraising event for 
150 + people.  She had the coffee dispensers ready on time, ready to load into my car, supplied all the extras (cups, stir sticks, napkins, etc) and was equally as helpful when we returned the empty containers.

Good to have you in the Neighborhood!
author: Nancy P.

description:
I open my shop late just to make sure I have a cup of coffee from Bernie's. I really love the taste of the coffee here. I'm not a coffee connoisseur. However, I know burnt coffee. There is always cream, sugar, etc. And that area is always clean when I've come in. 
The staff is always pleasant. Great diversity and they display a good working relationship with each other. I love over hearing their random convo's. 
Best part to me is you don't trip over baby strollers like the place down the street. With a street packed with coffee shops this place stands out. 
And if your a laptop totter, there is free WiFi.
author: Deejay K.

description: This place is ok. The staff was nice, I got a iced mocha that was good, free wifi, cute atmosphere but a bit dark inside. I sat at the sunny window so I was ok. If you live near there I would recommend it.
author: Karen T.

description: Great owner, staff, location, venue...and coffee. When I want coffee, I want espresso or coffee. That said, if I'm not making it at home, Bernie's is only place I'd go in the neighborhood for coffee or espresso--and the only place in town I buy coffee beans. They are  the best coffee beans in town, roasted weekly, from a very well established and very well respected local roaster. I'm surprised at the critiques of the coffee and espresso because, although nothing can compare to an individually brewed cup (a la Philz) for brewed coffee and beans, there is no question in my mind that you get better quality at Bernie's than at Peet's (which I like) and Starbucks (which I rely on when traveling for a dependably decent cup of coffee).
author: Timothy C.

description:
The best!!
Warm and friendly atmosphere with great coffee and snacks.
Bernie is lovely!!
My son asks to go there and he isn't even 2 yet.
author: lisa s.

description:
one year later and I am still in love with  Bernie and her crew.  each cup of jo is made with heaping amounts of  LOVE  from the staff!

Happy Anniversary to Bernie's coffee shop
author: Scott P.

description: Cannot say enough great things about this coffee shop and Bernie.  If there was a Bernie's on every corner, I would NEVER go back to Starbucks, and I wouldn't think twice about it.  From their drip coffee to their lattes to their mochas - everything I've tried is fabulous.  The counter is lined with glass jars of delectable treats, and the shop itself is filled with happy patrons, families, adorable babies, and the dogs are tied up out front.  Bernie herself is usually behind the counter, cheerfully greeting her patrons by name.  Has a wonderful, welcoming feel, and the chocolate dipped macaroons are to die for.  Lots of seating, including benches out front.  Free Wi-Fi (Starbucks doesn't have that either!) and great location (Whole Foods' next-door-neighbor)...I'm a Bernie's fan for life!
author: Jenna C.

description:
Bernie's is the best locally owned and independent coffee shop around.  There's plenty to like about Bernie's including the fact that you won't get a better cup of coffee served with a smile from any place else.  Everything about Bernie's makes it the kind of shop you want to support including the awesome coffee, the yummy snacks, and the wonderful staff.  You can just tell that Bernie is an awesome boss to have because her staff follow her lead in providing excellent service.

I don't know of any homeless people that hang out here like a previous poster wrote unless she means those of us who live and work in the neighborhood and who get our Spinelli's fix each day.

Do yourself a favor and check out Bernie's for yourself and you'll see why so many of us are rooting for the crew at Bernie's.
author: Gordon A.

description:
I'm back in San Francisco for vacation and I had to go back to my old neighborhood. Number one thing on my list was to go back to Bernie's and get an iced caramel macchiato. It was even better than I had remembered! The place still has the same friendly, low key feel and I absolutely love how nice the baristas and Bernie are. I will definitely be back to have at least one more coffee before I leave.
I only wish there was a Bernie's back in Boston!
author: Maya H.

description:
Even if this place were not locally owned and operated, and even if Bernie was not one of the most charming people to ever serve me my morning caffeine fix I would still give this place the highest rating it can have.

Great coffee, a fabulous staff and one of the most comfortable shops around.

If you like great coffee, need a haven from the hustle of the day, or care at all about independent stores surviving in San Francisco you must go to Bernie's on 24th.
author: David R.

description:
Bernie is, in fact, a moist muffin of a girl....that's why she's my girlfriend!

Oh, and the coffee and service is excellent too!
author: Erin L.

description:
Bernie's is a great place.
Good coffee and pastries.
The staff is SUPER nice.

This is where my friends and I meet to decide, "what's next".
author: Geordie E.

description:
Bernie took what was once Yet Another Corporate Cafe(c)(tm) and turned it into a thriving neighborhood epicenter. Bernie is always in the house, and is a great proprietor/host.

The staff is friendly, the drinks are strong, and the place is always full. Good luck nabbing one of the armchairs facing the front window! Those re-occupy faster than the parking spaces on 24th out front.

Happy coincidence and pleasant misfortunes abound at Bernie's. The  other day I was meeting with a friend for coffee, and my friend opted to get a tea cookie. Seeing that there were two of us at the table, they threw another cookie in so I wouldn't have to go without. Too, too kind.

When you go, be sure to seek out Bernie. She's a hoot, and a totally wonderful proprietor. Perfect compliment to 24th Street, and the ultimate option to the rubber stamp of Starbucks.
author: Greg Q.

description: A really nice local coffee spot - great people (servers and customers). Great coffee, pastries and places to sit. A major cut above the rest ... really don't understand how Starbucks can still be so busy ....?
author: Jo D.

description:
I just moved to Noe Valley and was in need of a good workspace since I'm a graduate student who "works from home."  I found it!  Why I love it:

#1: Good coffee, and the refills are FREEEEEE
#2: Plugs and lots of table space for laptops 
#3: Strong Free the Net signal
#4: The employees don't care that I buy one cup o' joe and stay 4-5 hours
#5: Their restroom is kept really clean (that's important!)

So all of that adds up to five stars!!
author: Shantal M.

description:
I recently rediscovered Bernie's when my internet connection was down and I was forced to find free wifi down the street. Not only did my trip to the cafe reacquaint me with the kick-ass coffee, but also with the woman serving it: Bernie, possibly the nicest woman in the neighborhood. She actually KNOWS a good number of the people in the cafe at any given time. Bernie's gives the best Noe Valley has to offer: a small-town, neighborhoody feel in the middle of a big city. 

The experience even made me feel a little better about the $70 I had to spend to get my internet connectivity problem solved by some guy in India.
author: Emily G.

description:
I remember when Tully's first bought Spinelli's they had a transition plan to make customers feel better by still offering some Spinelli's coffee blends. They even had the barristas where aprons with names and logos from both companies. Then overtime it became just another corporate coffee location complete with silly drinks and unhappy staff. 

I really gave Tully's a fair try and would go out of my way to go there rather than Starbucks. However it seemed like they did everything to not attract customers. I can't tell you how many times I went in there and there was huge line of people and one person working the counter making coffee and working register  while one or two other employees where hanging out in back. The payoff for me was when they only offered "lighter" coffee blends in the AM like Baseball Blend - yuk. When I asked the lame-o guys that worked there they said that's what customers prefer/ Huh? Have you been in SF long? Ever been to Peets? Hell even Starbucks offers and regular and darker option anytime you go in.

Anyway, enough whining about the past. Bernie and here new place are great. Place is always crowded now, much better atmosphere and the coffee is a huge improvement. Love Martha's but Bernie's my coffee gal for now.
author: John B.

description: Three stars for the coffee, which is decent; nothing special. Three stars also for the interior, which is a bit dark and often cramped. Five stars for the friendliness and competency of the owner and staff; I always walk out with a smile.
author: Pria W.

description:
Aww Bernie's! When I first moved to Noe Valley, I was frequenting the corner Starbucks because of the many  gift certificates stuffed in my wallet from various occasions. Now that they've been exhausted, I'm a true blue Bernie's supporter. It's local, independently owned and really just does the trick for a neighborhood coffee shop.

They have a good wireless internet connection, compostable cups, friendly service and yummy yummy treats.
author: Megan M.

description:
I recall a year ago walking down 24th Street with a friend and noticing the lights turned back on in the old Tully's Coffee shop.  There was a sign in the window offering a free cup of coffee.  Instantly attracting my cheap sensibilities and addiction to coffee at any hour, my friend and I walked in.  

Upon entering the shop, I immediately noticed that though the furniture had not changed, the same Tully's Pitch Fork and Axe handle chairs (what was the Tully's retail merchant thinking?), the atmosphere and attitude was fresh and welcoming.  I was also excited to see a new coffee shop on 24th at Noe that would be an alternative to the acidic and burnt tasting drip Starbucks called coffee in a cookie cutter atmosphere. 

We placed our order for that free cup, and then realized the woman taking our order was the new owner.  The sign wasn't yet hung outside, so the name of the shop was unclear.  When we asked the owner what she was going to call it, she said Bernie's, her name.  We walked out and wished her well, and I hoped to see this one stick.

A year later, this place is my base.  I didn't come here on a regular basis after my introduction, but being recently laid off, I went to find something in my neighborhood that had free Wi-Fi, good inexpensive coffee, and a way to get out of my apartment and continue my job search.  

What I have found at Bernie's is Bernie, the community, and a neighborhood.  Yes, the average age at times seems to be 60, given the infants and toddlers, mimicking the Noe Valley demographic, but it is unpretentious, hipster free, and you can get a cup of coffee, sit on your lap top, and get free refills with a smile.  Bernie is ubiquitous in the shop.  She greets each patron as a regular, and jokes as if she has known them forever.  I now come here just about everyday, sit for hours on the Internet, and look forward to Bernie treating me like a neighbor, not a dollar. 

Thank you Bernie; I wish you continued success.
author: Lander B.

description:
Bernie's is phenomenal. I like this cafe because it is actually a cafe -- not just another smug hipster staffed caffeine porn haus. Great space, great neighborhood, friendly staff, reasonable prices. All this, and still able to produce an outstanding americano.

Try their cheesecake bars!
author: Matt D.

description:
Bernie's is a great little local coffee shop!!  Bernie always speaks to the customers, remembers the regular's drink orders, everyone is super friendly, and they have a wonderful cozy atmosphere.  Don't go to the chain coffee shops!! 

Go to Bernie's!!!!!
author: Kathleen M.

description: This is truly a local haunt. With Starbucks just across the street, this place still serves a good brew and with folks on their laptops utilizing the wifi.
author: Johnson H.

description:
Ok, so I may be a little biased because I know and am friends with Bernie, the owner. But here it goes...

Bernie herself is a LOVELY person, she's actually my boyfriend's cousin. He took me to her coffee shop when I first went to visit his family (I'm from LA). She is super sweet and hilarious, and she is so passionate about her coffee shop. From the beginning I see her interacting with her staff as well as her customers, and she genuinely loves each of them. It really surprised me how well she knows her customers, she would ask them about their day, and what they have been up to, she even knew some of their drink orders already, I'm guessing it's because they are regulars. But you can't get that kind of customer service at Starbucks where you're just another face in the crowd. 

Her coffee is really good too as well as the baked goods she has out! I've sadly only been there twice because of where I live, but if I lived in SF, I would totally be a regular. Every time I visit, I always want to go there. Two times and the coffee did not disappoint, and I love my coffee!

The decor is so cozy and cute. Like someone else said, you feel like in your best friend's living room. Can't wait to go back again!

PS: She won either 2nd or 3rd place in a "Best Coffee in SF" poll!!
author: Karla N.

description: If you're looking for a  true small-town coffee shop vibe then Bernie's is your place!  The staff is always sweet and the vibe always so relaxed that it becomes a little oasis from the chaos of the city. Best of all,  Bernie knows her coffee and boy can they make good foam!
author: Lena K.

description: I love this place. I go almost every morning. The chairs are comfortable and the tables are solid and wont rock under your cup. I am so happy to support Bernies! I also find the staff there (those I have met), Ola, Angel, Julian and Bernie herself Awesome!
author: Jonica B.

description:
This is as charming a place I've been in a long time. The coffee is great, the simple atmosphere by itself is not unique. The power comes from the personality of the owner, Bernie (Bernadette). While visiting for the 1st time last September, spending several days there online, I wrote a blog piece about it. 

The atmosphere with the regulars and the interaction is soothing. With all the competition up and down 24th st. Bernie's always has a buzz. See the blog article here: http://budurl.com/qvy2
author: Tom J.

description: Really great vibe in here, and great coffee.  The baked goods are generally pretty good, but not the best.  Bernie is super friendly and classy, and her staff is professional and friendly as well.  Can be crowded sometimes, but that is to be expected based on location and quality.
author: Gwen C.

description: They are nice... prices are cheap... they have wireless... it is comfortable and chill... my favorite Noe Valley coffee joint.
author: Aaron W.

description: My favorite local cafe in town. The workers are so nice.
author: Beach L.

description: Very friendly locally owned coffee shop, fast, free wifi, decent coffee. try it!
author: Tom S.

description:
Everytime I walk into this lovely cafe I'm greeted with 
great warmth by every worker.  A great place for an 
afternoon treat! 

Sit and enjoy the sunshine on bench out in front!
It will definitely be the highlight of your day.
author: Kerry H.

description:
Love my hood and Bernie's is a great addition to it. Tully's was OK, Starbuck could go away and Martha's Brothers is nice but it gets too crowded. Welcome Bernie and thanks for setting up shop. 
The only thing that I would change is a to take away the packets of brown sugar and put a container, and away with the plastic sticks. 
Will go back though and have my med. coffee anytime.
author: Jacqueline A.

description:
Growing up in Noe Valley, I am glad to have this storefront back in the hands of locals. With a father addicted to Spinelli's coffee, I was sad when this local company was bought out by Tully's. Now that the storefront is back under local control, I am thrilled. Sorry, I still like Martha Bros. better, but I am still happy that something else moved in. 

If only we could take down Starbucks once and for all.
author: Morgan W.

description:
I often stop by this place than I'm on 24th. Cozy neighborhood feel, good coffee, friendly staff. If feels good!

My only wish is that they had a bit more variety in pastries and that the pastries were a bit fresher. I often crave a poppy seed muffin, a chocolate croissant or a danish but find myself starring at an almost empty shelf with a few scones and not much to choose from.
author: Kirill N.

description: Bernie's is great because it has free wifi and ample room for those that like to set up camp with their laptops and work for hours on end.  There's a nice flow of customers to provide some white noise.  The baristas are friendly and helpful with drink suggestions and the facilities are kept tidy and cute.  Great place to do a little work, read a book or catch up with friends for coffee.
author: Karen N.

description: Bernie is great. She learns your name and your order quickly, which is exactly what you want in a neighborhood spot. That said, the coffee just isn't that good. Too bad--Noe desperately needs a great coffee shop.
author: arielle r.

description: One of my simple pleasures in life is to drive down to the Valley from Twin Peaks, get a chocolate croissant at Noe Valley bakery, and enjoy it with an espresso from Bernie's while sitting on a bench on 24th Street. Bernie and her staff all really understand what a ristretto means and are so, so good at making me the perfect espresso, whether it's decaf or regular. Their espresso is never bitter. Rather, it's smooth... and served with a smile. Going to Bernie's is always a fun experience, and everyone there knows how to make you feel at home. A true neighborhood gem!
author: Belinda J.

description: The coffee is great, the staff is friendly. My only issue is that it's not conducive to working. There are a bunch of kids running around and the tables are small and shared with outlets spread throughout the space where you have to crawl through tables to plug in. I will definitely return for coffee and conversation but not to work. Sorry, I hoped to give this a better review!
author: Eliz M.

description: Just bought 1/4 lb of beans home to make my own cup of cap- these beans ( Espresso Speciale) were so fresh and full of aroma that you could still see the oil sheen. The finished cup of cap was equally aromatic and smooth! Love it!! I would come every week to replenish my supply if only I live closer! And best of all, I know I'm not supporting the Suckbucks chain.  Yay!!!
author: Lisa C.

description: Cute little family-like cafe in Noe Valley.  Very limited seating and lots of people on laptops taking advantage of the wireless internet...I feel like the place just isn't big enough to accommodate all the computer users (I write this even though I bring my laptop)
author: David H.

description:
Bernie's is our new favorite in Noe Valley! We were die-hard Starbuck's fans until we found out that 'local girl' Bernie took over the old Tully's space on 24th Street. The coffee is outstanding, as is the atmosphere and overall neighborhood feeling of the place. The sidewalk out front is always packed on the weekends - people like to hang out and talk. Bernie's smile, warm and genuine greeting, and fantastic personality will ensure that we continue to give her our business - she deserves it!
Hey! I love the t-shirt idea! Let's do it! We'll  buy some! And of course proudly wear them all over Noe Valley!
author: Jeffrey W.

description:
I. Love. Bernie's.

I visit Bernie everyday before work and order a hot chocolate with fun. No matter what my mood is, Bernie and her staff are quick to make me feel welcome, warm, and happy. I personally don't drink coffee and generally don't like the smell of it, but I love the aromas emanating from Bernie's coffee shop. I got a bag of ground coffee beans for my friend for Christmas and had no idea which type to get, but Bernie was extremely helpful and let me know exactly what I was looking for.

Aside from the business aspect, Bernie and her staff are all-around good people. If they're not too busy, they are always up for conversation. Once, my boss was not having the best day in the world, so Bernie came across the street with gingerbread people to cheer everyone up. Bernie's competing with some ridiculous chains with whom I have no interest, but I know other people do, and she's really doing an excellent job and keeping her business going. She knows how to make an excellent hot chocolate and has the best customer service around.
author: Alexa G.

description:
Bernie's is magical.  Sure, the coffee is good but what makes this place magical is the owner Bernie. This is fo sho my favorite coffee place on 24th street.
Starbucks is well, starbucks, gross coffee and equally if not more grotesque employees.
Martha Bros...i can't do it...literally I can't get in there due to the blockade of stollers.
author: kimstar p.

description:
this place epitomizes the neighborhood it's in, distilling what makes noe noe in one place.  so if you don't like seeing babies in their $1K+ strollers or working age people who don't work dressed in expensive casual clothes, don't come here. if you don't mind that so much then this is a decent place to stop in. there are only a couple of tables up front and the seating is hilariously cramped in the rest of the room.  lots of laptops, and people literally climbing over eachother to get plugged in.  My $3 capp was just ok - milk was steamed too long but somehow the drink wasn't hot enough. strange.

Still gets almost 4 stars because my imagination says with some work this could be a great place.  for instance: cut the barista counter by half and put in a few more tables at the front.  get rid of the spotty free wireless and the computer stations at the back.  and replace the clumsy rattan chairs that are too low for the main communal table!
author: Nikki F.

description: The lady that owns this coffee shop (Bernie) is a total sweetheart.
author: Beth C.

description: I've always thought the Caramel Macchiato at Starbucks is tasty until I ordered it from Bernies's.  The rich flavor captures every sensation of your tongue and makes you want to take just another sip before setting the cup down.  Staff is friendly and a great place to bond with your laptop on a Sunday afternoon.  Free wifi included.
author: Lian F.

description: Best coffee on 24th St. Martha's and Starbucks are acceptable, but a little to bitter by default for my taste. I guess it's possible those other coffee shops offer lighter roasts or something.
author: doug d.

description: One word.  Local.  The staff including the owner, literally know every single person that comes into this shop and it's so refreshing.  Filled with kids (it's noe valley) and parents and everyone in between.  Very cool.  Prices are good too....it helps that my friend that I was staying with lives above it.  10 feet to good coffee.  Yay.
author: Jesse K.

description: This place re-inspired me to open up my own coffeeshop one day.  Theres a story on the wall of the young lady that owns this place and how she came about to it.  Suddenly, time fast-forwarded and there was my picture on that wall with my story too...its a great one too that one day I'd like to share.  This place has "that feelin" I look for.  It has "that ambiance" of a small community...you know that song from cheers "sometimes you wanna go where everybody knows your name."  Well, the tune was playing in my head while I was here.  It was a perfect refuge too from the heavy rain pouring outside!  Of course, this made the coffee taste even better.
author: Nina D.

description: The best neighborhood coffee shop I have found in the city. Being local to Noe Valley, Bernie's is a perfect way to start the day with a tasty cup of their drip coffee. I am not much for all the "frofee" coffee drinks, therefore I will not comment on their other coffee drinks. Their pastries ans scones always look tasty, even though I have yet to try them. I love there padded chairs right in the front window to people watch, read SF Weekly or just chat with my roommate or friend. It is a very popular Noe Valley place to go, so give it a shot!
author: Nate R.

description: When I first moved here, I discovered Bernie's as a fabulous place to use internet and sip tea for ... hours.  The staff are super friendly and accommodating.  You feel like you've gone to someone's house for tea.  Lots of locals hang out here and there's a great energy.  Great place to people watch, pass the time, surf the net and just be.
author: Redwood T.

description: Bernie the owner very nice .......her brother Dennis cool and even  Bernie's mother works there   nice place for coffee    local owner       coffee is great
author: tommy b.

description: I was randomly in Noe Valley and stopped here for a Latte and it was *really* good. and cute and friendly in there. I will definitely be getting coffee here when I'm in the neighborhood again.
author: Dana C.

description: I wouldn't say I'm so much a Bernie's regular as Bernie's addict. I come here almost every morning and Bernie and her staff are always so nice and cheery, know exactly what I want and really help me to start my day off on a positive note - especially those rough 5:30am starts. I'm obsessed with her hazelnut cafe au lait, which is always perfectly made with the right amount of each ingredient. The coffee is flavorful and robust, but never bitter, and the milk is perfectly steamed every time. I'm a big fan of quality, consistency and spirit - all of which Bernie and her morning staff have in spades.
author: Kristina A.

description: Pleasant ambience, good service, soy and almond milk both available, soft and hard seating, vegan sweets.  Nice place.
author: Bob G.

description: You don't just get a cup of coffee at Bernie's. You get coffee made with love. Bernie remembers each regular's order and makes each cup of coffee with a calm smile. And she's the owner & the one usually making the coffee drinks.
author: Sara L.

description: Like lots of coffee shops in the city, it's just alright. It gets the job done. Once in a while I'll get something "fancy," and I tend to while I'm here. My mochas are always steamed beyond belief- making them piping hot and watery. Not the best. But hey, if it helps me get thru a 6:30-9:30 night class at CCSF- then so be it.  It's kind of nice that they take cards for being a locally owned place and all. I still wish there was a Peet's nearby however.
author: Lauren S.

description: Nothing wrong with Bernie's - it's just ok in my books.  It's the local (and loved by many) coffee place in Noe and just not that interesting to me any of the times I've dropped by.  Customerwise, employeewise, snackwise.....  I want to like it but it just comes across kind of generic.  I keep trying though cause it's in my neighborhood.  I like a medium coffee and the drip coffee is pretty strong - maybe a lighter roast could be offered as well?
author: Dizzy L.

description: I'm always looking for good coffee- and want to support local businesses.  I found it here.  On a sunny day, it's a great place to sit out on the sidewalk and drink a GOOD cup of coffee as opposed to a couple chains on the same street with mediocre-at best-coffee.  I did have a weird caramel latte that I won't have again, it was weak and watery.  I'll stick to the fresh coffee. Everyone who works there is really friendly too.
author: stephanie s.

description: Yummy coffee served with a smile! Who could ask for more.  Plus Bernie herself is a local gal and a truly lovely person!
author: Laura P.

description: Bernie's is simply the best.  I go there at least once a day for my caffeine fix as well as to people watch.  Bernie is a sweet, wonderful person, and I'm happy to give her my money for great coffee.  All of her employees are great.  If you live in Noe Valley and get your coffee anywhere else you should consider having your head examined.
author: Findfortyseven ..

description: I've tried a couple of the coffee places in Noe Valley, and Bernie's is my favorite by far. I'm a pretty boring person when it comes to the drink I order at coffee places. I always stick to my latte with vanilla soy milk. Bernie's lattes are satisfying and give me my java fix. The ratio between the espresso and soy milk is just right. I also feel like Bernie's is pretty reasonably priced. At other places the existing drink prices + the soy milk option isn't always easy on the wallet. Service is always excellent. All of the workers I have encountered have been extremely personable. I can't give it another star yet, because I haven't tried out any of the baked goods they offer.
author: Bonita L.

description: Service was very friendly and helpful but unfortunately the coffee was not the best coffee I'll ever have as I was promised. I mean really...is the greatest cup of coffee I'll ever have in all my days really too much to ask? Promises were made and I was left wanting. Honestly though the coffee was better than average and I was quite satisfied. Wish I had a more exotic drink order than coffee, black but I gotta be me.
author: Don L.

description: I really love Bernie's.  Not only is the coffee good and the service fast, but the ambiance is great...way warmer and friendlier than the Starbucks up the street.  It is a real neighborhood cafe...right out of the streets of France, with a Noe Valley twist.  It also helps that Bernie is super cute and outgoing.  It is a place where even if you haven't been there for awhile, everyone still knows your name.
author: Adam E.

description: I'm from New Jersey and first discovered Bernie's on a trip to San Fran in 2003. Although I don't get out there nearly as often as I'd like, whenever I'm in town, I make it a point to go to Bernie's. It's much friendlier and more comfortable than those big, corporate chains with their cookie-cutter shops and inflated prices. I just got a cup of some very strong, excellent brew and a freshly baked chocolate chip cookie (that's important, too) last Thursday. It was worth the struggle to find a parking spot.
author: Bob F.

description: This is the antidote to retail cynicism.  The only thing better than the coffee is the service of the staff, who are SO nice--*amazing* customer service, which clearly comes straight from the top--Bernie!  The staff are kind and cool, but not in a hippier-than-thou way; this is the first time I have ever wanted to go back to a place enough to get to be a "regular."  And again, did I mention that the coffee was great, and the latte not overly sweet?  What a treat all around!
author: SuDan F.

description: I was glad enough just to see an independent replace a chain, but then I tried the coffee -- wow! I might actually end up feeling sorry for Starbuck's. Best of both worlds, at least til Bernie starts offering more food? Pick up food at Martha Bros. down the street and then head to one of Bernie's benches for some real coffee to go with. Heaven.
author: Laura R.

description: I still crave the savory scone pastry thing that I got at this cute little coffee shop. It had han and cheese chunks in it and was moist, buttery and delicious! The employees were very nice and welcoming- I could tell they have a lot of regulars who all seem to enjoy the atmosphere here. If I lived closer, I would get one of those scones every week....
author: Heather I.

description:
one rainy day during the first month of my tenancy in noe valley, starbucks was closed (gasp) due to an issue with their electricity.  what was a caffiene-starved girl to do?  figaro and i trekked down the street and ran into bernie's.  an adorable, unassuming little coffee house that seems funky despite it's location.

i ordered my usual small double latte, no foam and waited in suspense.  it was delicious!  and very friendly service and not overpriced!  yay!  i will be supporting bernie's, a local business, from now on!

UPDATE - you can bring your pooch inside!  what more could i ask for?
author: Natalie H.

description: Definitely my favorite coffee spot. I'm not a huge coffee fan, nor do I drink it regularly - but when I do, I get it from Bernie's. I love the atmosphere here, it's peaceful and never stressed. Whenever I'm in Starbucks I feel like I have to be on guard because it's very high strung energy might just run me down... but not here - nice and easy.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
i essentially got a job because of bernie's. well, not really, but they let me sit there for hours on end for multiple days in a row as i wrote cover letters, so I think they deserve some props. 

the jasmine pearl tea is divine, and they'll refill your cup with hot water as often as you like.

the chocolate cookie with sugar on top (don't judge!) is an excellent afternoon snack.

everyone who works there is friendly and there is free internet!!!
author: Jessa L.

description:
so lovely. kind, wonderful people (what really makes it), comfortable, and good coffee. so glad i didn't have to go to starbucks to do homework.

everything a neighborhood coffee place should be.
author: carrie d.

description:
Strollers?! Strollers? You want strollers? Bernie's got strollers.  Whenever I'm on the hunt for a watermelon holder, I know I can count on Bernie's. 

Better still, Bernie has delicious coffee and the staff is great.

-1 star for super weak wireless reception, at least on my wack-ass lappy.  That may be the nerdiest deduction possible, but I gotta be me.
author: Srikanth S.

description:
This place is friendly with great coffee - a real community hub.

The fact that it's dark is a plus in my book - it helps with the laptop screen.

I only have one complaint - the flies!  I sometimes feel like they should provide swatters with their coffee.  Really annoying, not nice to look at and it doesn't speak to their apparent hygiene.

Clean up the flies Bernie!
author: James C.

description: Bernie's is now my default local coffee-shop.   The owner has set up a perfect environment for grabbing a quick coffee or for sitting down and surfing the internet for 3 hours.  I do occasionally cheat and get a soy latte at Starbucks, but the nice employees at Bernie's always welcome me back with open arms.
author: beth m.

description: Bernie serves up the best coffee on 24th Street, hands down (sorry Martha Bros.)  Not only is she a super-skilled barista herself, but also has a similarly knowledgeable and friendly staff. It also helps that she takes the time to remember what her regulars order, so when I arrive in my sleepy a.m. state, she's already working on my double-soy-iced-latte. Thanks, Bernie! Because of you, my mornings are most certainly more lovely because they're laced with your espresso.
author: Gillian H.

description:
the only good coffee on 24th. bernie's does not over roast their beans like everyone else.
 
seriously... how can coffee shops not get this right?
although starbucks across the street may be consistent product... i simply don't go there on principle. 

bernie's is cute, social, and has a family feel. there is a definite sense of community inside.
author: SF U.

description: If you like warm milk with a slight hint of coffee - stay at Starbucks.  If you want an ok coffee with excellent food selection - go to Martha's Bros.  But if you want the best cappuccino in the neighborhood, the most friendly service, the best WiFi connection, then Bernie's is the right place for you.  I think they make the best espresso drinks, period.  The atmosphere is warm and social.  There are books for the kids and benches outside.  The place has a great character and we are glad to have such a special coffee shop in our neghborhood.
author: Yevgenia F.

description: I wanted a spot to wait for Swords, Lasers, and Cocktails and I found it. Clean, airy, cozy (no those two are not contradictory). The seats are just fine, and I could happily read my Greek or Latin texts here for an hour or two.
author: Marcus M.

description: My favorite cafe in the CIty.  The owner and staff are delightful!  Everyone knows one another and it seems the neighborhood revolves around this place.  Oh yea, the coffee is great as well, not like many of the stuffy and hipster coffee houses around the City (they serve the coffee from a a large brew pot, not by the cup).
author: Alexandra F.

description: This place has the coolest barristas in all the city... cept maybe those dudes at caffe trieste in north beach, they might just be a little cooler. but all around, good environment and coffee. BOYCOTT STARBUCKS!!!!
author: J. G.

description:
I was on a hunt for a cute, cozy cafe with wifi and that is when I stumbled upon Bernie's. It is a perfect mix of homey and a little escape from the otherwise hectic life in the city. The serene colored walls, mixed with the white molding, dark wood furniture and counter, and track lighting blend perfectly. The staff is friendly, and there are plenty of tables and chairs to settle into. There is even a kids corner with a chalkboard door they can write on and plenty of books and coloring tools available.

My only areas of suggestion for this cafe are:
1. Having more and bigger art on the walls would really contribute to a unique, warming environment. There are a few small black and white pictures up, which is nice, but some interesting art would really add to the place.

2. The counter is a bit crowded on one end with regular store bought items: canisters of tea, coffee filers, lollipops, on top of many bottled beverages in the glass case. I love independent coffee shops for their own made items, not for selling grocery items. If they did away with all of this and scaled up their in house pastries it would feel more like a cafe and less like a grocery store.

Otherwise, this place is fabulous!
author: Deborah Q.

description:
Great coffee shop. I love their chai tea and they are very nice.
I would love to have more comfortable chairs though. I find their prices are lower than other coffee shops. If I have a choice for coffee or tea, Bernie's is the one I'd go in Noe Valley.
author: isa p.

description:
also got to give it 5-stars.  I actually wanted not to like this place because I was bitter that Peet's wasn't coming in, but the place is solid...and while I still am partial to my Peet's, I really do like this place's coffee.  Strong, but not crazy strong so that my friend's wouldn't like it.  

Kudo's to the staff there.
author: Jonathan H.

description: Excellent coffee, super-friendly staff ( Bernie, the owner, is a total sweetheart ), and free wifi.  Definitely the best coffee place in Noe Valley.
author: Tim A.

description: best coffee and atmosphere in the neighborhood. why would anyone go to Starbucks across the street? Bernie's beans are the best (even better than Martha's) and the staff is really nice...especially Bernie!
author: Michael F.

description: It was ok.  Service was decent.  Love that it is local and chick owned. I will have to try much more to give an accurate review.  But for my first time there I wasn't THAT impressed.  We were really looking forward to trying it.  I will definitely try it again to be fair.  But it was really crowded with people just sitting there using the free internet. It wasn't a very warm and cozy place.  I  was with a group and we didn't really want to sit down and sip our coffee.  I am still on the look out for a great coffee place in Noe, but will be back to give Bernie's another chance ( I will update review if opinion improves).  Bottom line:  Will keep looking for that great coffee place.
author: Roberta J.

description: Bernie's is great.  And Bernie herself is great.  It's a rare and special experience in SF to know that the owner of a cafe not only lives in the neighborhood but works in her cafe as well.  I'll keep this review simple and sweet, like the cafe itself.
author: Katy W.

description: I truly cannot say enough good things about Bernie's!  I moved to San Francisco a few months ago and lived in Noe Valley for a few weeks.  I was very happy to stumble in one morning.  Within a few visits Bernie knew me and exactly what I normally drank.  Friendly conversation (which, believe it or not I welcomed pre-coffee) was always a definite must.  I still try to get here as much as I can even though I moved out of the way to the Mission.  If you want great service, a friendly atmosphere and a good start to your day, head here.
author: Ryan K.

description: I love Bernie's!  It's my local coffee shop and they make a great cup of joe.  The staff (especially the owner, who always seems to be there) has always been really friendly.  It makes me sick when I see people down the street at Starbucks...don't they know they have such a great place up the street without the nasty burnt coffee!?  Plus, it's just fun to say Bernie's!
author: Michael S.

description: I'm sipping an awesome honey sugar free hazelnut non-fat latte and using their free Wifi as I yelp. Can't believe it took me so long to find out about this place. Great Noe Valley spot, especially on a cold, breezy San Francisco afternoon. Wish the chairs were more comfortable, but a minor inconvenience for otherwise good coffee and ambiance.
author: Jason B.

description: On of SF's  best neighborhood coffee shops. Bernie is the best ! Once she knows your order she will have it poured before you reach the counter. She is extreamly friendly and on top of it. !! Crew is great too. Open at 5:30 am . My kind of place!!
author: Frank H.

description:
I really enjoy Bernie's which is accros the street however, I also enjoy Martha's.   

Bernie is extremely friendly, outgoing, perky, and really intense.   Which is sometimes hard to take in, but with good intentions.  She saw this little boy and said "ohh, you look like a rabbit"  she sees in your soul.  So enjoy it!!
She is intense!!! its fun
author: Ethan L.

description:
Best coffee in the city, cute girl owns Bernie's, take a guess at her name.  

My story:

I finished working out and wanted a coffee but as I went to pay I didn't bring my wallet.  They still gave me my drink without deposit of my iPod, wallet, or pint of blood.  It's nice to have neighbors that own neighborhood businesses.  I doubt Starbucks down the street would do the same.
Cheers Bernie!
author: Paul R.

description: really super nice staff.  everytime i go there, i stop by whole foods, grab some lunch, and come and just surf the web. they never complain about me eating my lunch in there, bernie is super sweet and seems to know everyone on a first name basis, the drinks are good, and theres just a cute friendly neighborhood feel.
author: Renee S.

description: Coffee is yummy, thumbs up for strawberry scones too.  (And they have Mission Mini cupcakes!).  Not a lot of seating, and it seems like there are constantly big delivery trucks blocking the sunny benches outside, but you can take your coffee to go and browse 24th St.
author: Sara S.

description: OK, I've had it with this cafe. I tried to like it. The coffee is pretty good, the interior is welcoming and the staff is always friendly. But the people that come here suck! I got there when it was relatively empty, and I was at a big table with my papers spread onto 1 space next to me. There were 5 empty seats at the table so this didn't seem like a big deal. Out of nowhere some guy sits down right next to me, and is about to put his stuff down on top of my papers, glaring at me the whole time. So I move my stuff to the other side. A little while later, some women show up and do the exact same thing. Really, would it kill you folks to say "excuse me" or "mind if I sit here?" Then there were folks who brought their barking dogs in. And of course, the screaming (albeit cute) kids running around. This is NOT the place to go if you want to read quietly or do some work. Or relax. Or do anything but talk to your friends at high volumes.
author: Anonymous F.

description: love bernie's although i thought bernie would be a man but she's a local gal, how sweet and adorable is that? much like the free wifi cafe where there's a water bowl for dogs at the entrance. writers and students come with their laptops, preferably macs and sit there and milk there kawfee until bernie gives them the eye for takin' up space and breathing her high rent air. just kidding, she seems nice and not to mind that i sat their for over 3 hours the other day with the jitters from her excellent grinds with a personal touch.
author: dan T.

description: This is the best coffee shop in Noe Valley.  It is well-run with a friendly staff and good coffee.  There are a variety of seating options, w-fi is available but its not one of those shops wher no one is talking and everyone is chesking their email.  Great, friendly atmosphere.
author: pauline e.

description: In my search for a study spot closer to my apt., I came across this small, quaint little coffee shop called "BERNIE'S- alocal girl's coffee shop.  I must say it is a very adorable little spot!!! The employees were very attentive, and nice.  Although it could require more ventilation, but it's all good, I had my iced coffee and a nice table where I was able to spread my books and get my study on.  I stuck around for a couple of hours and in between sections, I entertained myself with checkin' out the drawings done by the local kids, I heart the sign that said, "UNATTENDED CHILDREN WILL BE GIVEN AN ESPRESSO SHOT AND A PUPPY" hahaha now what best watch ur kids while they draw LOL, ohh they have the cutest selections of kid's books.  Ok so i think it's more than a coffee shop, it's the spot one can bring family and friends and enjoy a cup of joe, some pastry and if you've got kids, have an art day at =)  GOOD JOB BERNIE'S!!!
author: Ryan M.

description: Bernie is so nice, and so are the other baristas.  I love the honey hazelnut latte.  The coffee is a lighter roast than Starbucks and some other cafes.  The baked goods aren't as good as Martha & Bro.'s selection down the street (but honestly, their selection is just above and beyond ridiculousness), but it has improved greatly in the last few months.  The space is comfortable, there's free wifi, and you can use a Sticky Card here to accumulate points for a free drink.
author: Cindy L.

description: Nice place, very mellow, great coffee, Bernie is great, no complaints.  I usually just get a latte and soak up the calm vibes.
author: Edward K.

description: First off, Bernie has balls to open a coffee shop across the street from Starbucks and down the block from Martha & Brothers.  That said, WAKE UP NOE VALLEY! GO TO BERNIE'S! Seriously, her coffee is better than Starbucks, and it's served by Bernie! Who is the sweetest lady ever. And cute as a button. Can you say that about old man Starbuck? No! All he ever does is sit around smoking cigars and rubbing his crotch. That said, this morning I walked into Starbucks to get a Vente Coffe (and I always feel like a stupid jackass, "oh, oh look at me, i'm all grande' and vente' and..." but anyway, so the line was out the door. So I left and went to Bernie's. I'm so gay for Bernie and her coffee too. There was no line, and I ordered a medium, not like a dumbass. And also, Bernie's is the best thing ever. Go to Bernie's.
author: Laney B.

description: Love you guys! Free coffee refills, free Bernie's internet, nice owner who is always there, fun girly upbeat music! Plus, right before they close they give away their pastries (I was there once for that!). Apparently my friend's wallet was stolen there and she always complains about the "homeless" people that hang out there, but I haven't had the same complaints!
author: E M.

description: Nice people, friendly crowd. A little dark, unless you can get one of 5 seats in near the window. Coffee is good too. Prefer to come here on a quiet day.
author: Victoria A.

description: yay!  a nice neighborhood alternative to starbucks.
author: Carmen M.

description: Love, love Bernie's - love Bernie too.  Friendly, light-hearted atmoshphere, great coffee, and a wicked hot chocolate.  Anytime I'm in the neighborhood I gotta make a stop there.  Cheers to the "local girl" opening up shop.
author: Adrian M.

description: Great to see this place take over from Tully's. I have been told they use the same beans once used by Spinelli's coffee. Those of us who have live in SF for 10 years or more will remember that. Only time I have had a problem is getting onto WiFi but it's the great coffee that I come for!
author: Paul R.

description: My new favorite place in San Francisco.  I wandered around a little lost until I walked into Bernie's. The staff (including the owner) was fantastic. A store like this makes me realize how far the Starbucks and the Peets the world have lost touch with their customers.
author: matthew a.

description: Benie we are so proud of you.  The hard work is paying off.  It is so nice to see all the great reviews of your store.  It is so DESERVED.   We are so happy to see you smiling and happy in a business we knew you would do so well in.  Congrats and keep on making a GREAT cup of coffee.  I haven't been to a Starbucks or Martha's since you opened.  I just can't stand the taste of that coffee anymore. You REALLY brew a GREAT cup of coffee.  I am truly disappointed when I don't have the time after work to stop by and enjoy your coffee.
author: Sheila C.

description: By far and away the best part of Noe Valley ...
author: Christopher L.

description: this place can get a little packed at times, but it still earns 5 stars.  seating is limited, but at the same time it makes for intimate coffee drinking, computing and lounging.  they have few benches outside that you can sit on and people watch.  the wifi seems to be of 5 star quality as well.  if you are a telecommuter for example and live in the noe area or even a bit farther out, it's worth a visit.  i typically ride my bike in and pass half dozen coffee shops but still choose Bernie's .  Who is Bernie anyway?
author: San Francisco B.
